column1: resolved_text

Fred Astaire was born in Omaha, Nebraska, to Johanna (Geilus) and Fritz Austerlitz, a brewer. Fred Astaire entered show business at age 5. Fred Astaire was successful both in vaudeville and on Broadway in partnership with Fred Astaire's sister, Adele Astaire. After his sister, Adele Astaire retired to marry in 1932, Fred Astaire headed to Hollywood. Signed to RKO, Fred Astaire was loaned to MGM to appear in La danza di Venere (1933) before starting work on RKO's Carioca (1933). In RKO's Carioca (1933), Fred Astaire began Fred Astaire's highly successful partnership with Ginger Rogers, with whom Fred Astaire danced in 9 RKO pictures. During these years, Fred Astaire was also active in recording and radio. On film, Fred Astaire later appeared opposite a number of partners through various studios. After a temporary retirement in 1945-7, during which Fred Astaire opened Fred Astaire Dance Studios, Fred Astaire returned to film to star in more musicals through 1957. Fred Astaire subsequently performed a number of straight dramatic roles in film and TV.

One of Hollywood's preeminent male stars of all time, James Cagney was also an accomplished dancer and easily played light comedy. James Cagney was born on the Lower East Side of Manhattan in New York City, to Carolyn (Nelson) and James Francis Cagney, Sr., who was a bartender and amateur boxer. James Cagney was of Norwegian (from James Cagney's maternal grandfather) and Irish descent. Ending three decades on the screen, James Cagney retired to James Cagney's farm in Stanfordville, New York City (some 77 miles/124 km. north of James Cagney's New York City birthplace), after starring in Billy Wilder's Uno, due, tre! (1961). James Cagney emerged from retirement to star in the 1981 screen adaptation of E.L. Doctorow's novel "Ragtime" (Ragtime (1981)), in which James Cagney was reunited with James Cagney's frequent co-star of the 1930s, Pat O'Brien, and which was James Cagney's last theatrical film and his frequent co-star of the 1930s, Pat O'Brien as well). James Cagney's final performance came in the title role of the made-for-TV movie Terrible Joe Moran (1984), in which James Cagney played opposite Art Carney.

Born to Alice Cooper and Charles Cooper. Gary attended school at Dunstable school England, Helena Montana and Grinnell College, Grinnell, Iowa (then called Iowa College). Gary's first stage experience was during high school and college. Afterwards, Gary worked as an extra for one year before getting a part in a two-reeler by the independent producer Hans Tiesler . Eileen Sedgwick was Gary's first leading lady. Gary then appeared in Fiore del deserto (1926) for United Artists before moving to Paramount. While there Gary appeared in a small part in Ali (1927), Cosetta (1927), and other films.

Georges Delerue was born on March 12, 1925 in Roubaix, Nord, France as Georges Delerue. Georges Delerue was a composer, known for Platoon (1986), I gemelli (1988) and Il giorno del delfino (1973). Georges Delerue was married to Micheline Gautron. Georges Delerue died on March 20, 1992 in Los Angeles, California, USA.

Born in London, England, John Gielgud trained at Lady Benson's Acting School and RADA, London, England. Best known for John Gielgud's Shakespearean roles in the theater, John Gielgud first played Hamlet at the age of 26. John Gielgud worked under the tutelage of Lilian Bayliss with friend and fellow performer Laurence Olivier and other contemporaries of the National Theatre at the "Old Vic", London, England. John Gielgud made John Gielgud's screen debut in 1924. Academy Award Best Supporting Actor, 1981, for Arturo (1981), Academy Award Nomination, 1964, for Becket e il suo re (1964).

Born in Portland, Oregon, she grew up in on a farm in Ketchum, Idaho. But dad was Jack Hemingway, son of the Nobel prize winning author Ernest Hemingway and, with that heritage, fame was almost foreordained. By the time she was 21, after the lead in the rape melodrama Stupro (1976), she had a budding movie career, a $1 million promotional contract with Faberge perfume, and her face on magazine covers around the world. But, within the decade, it was all lost. Her sister Mariel Hemingway, whose role in the rape melodrama Stupro (1976) had been suggested by Margaux, was a much greater success; she had started drinking heavily; two marriages had failed. In 1988, she checked herself into the Betty Ford Center for rehabilitation. Attempts to parley her recovery from alcohol into a revived career failed and, by the time she was 41, almost nothing was left. She lived alone in a studio apartment, no children, no lover, few friends. Neighbors informed police that she had not been seen for days and, on July 1, police entered through a 2nd floor window. Dental records had to be used to confirm her identity.

William Holden was born William Franklin Beedle, Jr. in O'Fallon, Illinois, to Mary Blanche (Ball), a schoolteacher, and William Franklin Beedle, Sr., an industrial chemist. William Holden came from a wealthy family (the Beedles) that moved to Pasadena, California, when William Holden was three. In 1937, while studying chemistry at Pasadena Junior College, William Holden was signed to a film contract by Paramount. William Holden's first starring role was as a young man torn between the violin and boxing in Passione (1939). From then on William Holden was typecast as the boy-next-door.After returning from World War II military service, William Holden got two very important roles: Joe Gillis, the gigolo, in Viale del tramonto (1950), and the tutor in Nata ieri (1950). two very important roles were followed by William Holden's Oscar-winning role as the cynical sergeant in Stalag 17 (1953). William Holden stayed popular through the 1950s, appearing in such films as Picnic (1955). William Holden spent much of William Holden's later time as co-owner of the Mount Kenya Safari Club, dividing William Holden's time between Africa and Switzerland.

Deborah Jane Trimmer was born on 30 September 1921 in Glasgow, Scotland, the daughter of Captain Arthur Kerr Trimmer. Deborah Jane Trimmer was educated at Northumberland House, Clifton, Bristol. Deborah Jane Trimmer first performed at the Open Air Theatre in Regent's Park, London. Deborah Jane Trimmer subsequently performed with the Oxford Repertory Company 1939-40. Deborah Jane Trimmer's first appearance on the West End stage was as Ellie Dunn in "Heartbreak House" at the Cambridge Theatre in 1943. Deborah Jane Trimmer performed in France, Belgium and Holland with ENSA (Entertainments National Service Association, or Every Night Something Awful) - The British Army entertainment service. Deborah Jane Trimmer has appeared in many films from Deborah Jane Trimmer's first appearance in Il maggiore Barbara (1941).

Peter Lorre was born László Lowenstein on Rózsahegy, Hungary. Peter Lorre was educated in elementary and secondary schools in Vienna, Austria. As a youth, Peter Lorre ran away from home, worked as a bank clerk and, after stage training in Vienna, Austria, made Peter Lorre's acting debut in Zurich. Peter Lorre remained unknown, traveling for several years and acting in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, until Fritz Lang cast Peter Lorre as the psychopathic child killer in M - Il mostro di Düsseldorf (1931). After several more films in Germany, Peter Lorre left as the Nazis came to power, going to Paris, London and, in 1935, Hollywood. Peter Lorre played Raskolnikov in Ho ucciso! (1935) and a series of Mr. Moto movies during the late 1930s. Peter Lorre began Peter Lorre's pairing with Sydney Greenstreet as Joel Cairo in Il mistero del falco (1941), continued in Casablanca (1942) and seven other films during the early 1940s. In Germany, Peter Lorre wrote, directed and starred in Un uomo perduto (1951). After that, somewhat heavier, Peter Lorre played in a string of not-so-stellar efforts, one exception being Peter Lorre's role as a clown in Il grande circo (1959). Peter Lorre died from a stroke the year Peter Lorre made Peter Lorre's last movie, playing a stooge in Jerry Lewis' Jerry 8 e 3/4 (1964).

Born in Cleveland, Ohio, but brought up in Pennsylvania, where Mancini played the flute in a local band, as a youth, before sending some arrangements to Benny Goodman. Benny Goodman offered Mancini a job and, after serving in WWII, Mancini joined the rearranged Glenn Miller band. In 1952, Mancini was given a two-week assignment at Universal to work on an Bud Abbott and Lou Costello film and ended up staying for six years. Success with La storia di Glenn Miller (1954) allowed Mancini to score many other films, helping along the way to change the style of film background music by injecting jazz into the traditional orchestral arrangements of the 1950s. Mancini was nominated for 18 Oscars and won four; in addition, Mancini won 20 Grammys and 2 Emmys, made over 50 albums and had 500 works published. Mancini collaborated extensively with Blake Edwards -- firstly on TV's Peter Gunn (1958), then on Colazione da Tiffany (1961), which won Mancini two Oscars; Mancini won further Oscars for the titles song for I giorni del vino e delle rose (1962) and the score for Victor Victoria (1982); Mancini will be best-remembered for the theme tune for La pantera rosa (1963).

The bushy-browed, cigar-smoking wise-cracker with the painted-on moustache and stooped walk was the leader of The Marx Brothers. With one-liners that were often double entendres, The bushy-browed, cigar-smoking wise-cracker with the painted-on moustache and stooped walk never cursed in any of The bushy-browed, cigar-smoking wise-cracker with the painted-on moustache and stooped walk's performances and said The bushy-browed, cigar-smoking wise-cracker with the painted-on moustache and stooped walk never wanted to be known as a dirty comic. With a great love of music and singing (The Marx Brothers started as a singing group), one of the things The bushy-browed, cigar-smoking wise-cracker with the painted-on moustache and stooped walk was best known for was The bushy-browed, cigar-smoking wise-cracker with the painted-on moustache and stooped walk's rendition of the song "Lydia the Tattooed Lady."

Alfred Newman was born on March 17, 1901 in New Haven, Connecticut, USA. Alfred Newman is known for Alfred Newman's work on Eva contro Eva (1950), Airport (1970) and La conquista del West (1962). Alfred Newman was married to Martha Montgomery and Mary Lou Dix. Alfred Newman died on February 17, 1970 in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA.

Shirley Temple was easily the most popular and famous child star of all time. Shirley Temple got Shirley Temple's start in the movies at the age of three and soon progressed to super stardom. Shirley Temple could do it all: act, sing and dance and all at the age of five! Fans loved Shirley Temple as Shirley Temple was bright, bouncy and cheerful in Shirley Temple's films and Fans ultimately bought millions of dollars' worth of products that had Shirley Temple's likeness on them. Dolls, phonograph records, mugs, hats, dresses, whatever it was, if it had Shirley Temple's picture on there Fans bought it. Shirley Temple was box-office champion for the consecutive years 1935-36-37-38, beating out such great grown-up stars as Clark Gable, Bing Crosby, Robert Taylor, Gary Cooper and Joan Crawford. By 1939, Shirley Temple's popularity declined. Although Shirley Temple starred in some very good movies like Da quando te ne andasti (1944) and the L'intraprendente signor Dick (1947), Shirley Temple's career was nearing her career's end. Later, Shirley Temple served as an ambassador to Ghana and Czechoslovakia. It was once guessed that Shirley Temple had more than 50 golden curls on Shirley Temple's head.

Natalie Wood was born on July 20, 1938 in San Francisco, California, USA as Natalia Nikolaevna Zacharenko. Natalie Wood was an actress, known for Gioventù bruciata (1955), West Side Story (1961) and Splendore nell'erba (1961). Natalie Wood was married to Richard Gregson and Robert Wagner. Natalie Wood died on November 29, 1981.

Born in Shenyang, grew up in Jinan, the daughter of an economics professor. Loved music from childhood, and dreamed of a singing career. After failing to gain entrance to China's top music school in 1985, applied for and was admitted to the Central Drama Academy in Beijing, from which Gong's graduated in 1989. While still a student, was cast as the female lead in Sorgo rosso (1988)(aka "Red Sorghum"), the initial directing effort by Yimou Zhang. China's's best-known actress in the West, Gong's was named Best Actress at the 49th Venice International Film Festival for Gong's's role in La storia di Qiu Ju (1992) (aka "The Story of Qiu Ju"). Made a series of successful films with Yimou Zhang, a collaboration that apparently ended with the breakup of their personal relationship in 1995 and Gong's subsequent marriage to a tobacco company executive.

Henner Hofmann was born in July 1950 in Mexico. Henner Hofmann is a cinematographer and producer, known for Tesoro, mi si sono ristretti i ragazzi (1989), La leyenda de una máscara (1991) and Jonás y la ballena rosada (1995).

Elena Koreneva was born on October 3, 1953 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR as Elena Koreneva. Elena Koreneva is an actress and casting director, known for Asya (1978), Eyo zvali Mumu (2016) and Van Gogi (2018).

Armin Mueller-Stahl was born on December 17, 1930 in Tilsit, East Prussia, Germany. Armin Mueller-Stahl is an actor and director, known for La promessa dell'assassino (2007), Shine (1996) and The International (2009). Armin Mueller-Stahl has been married to Gabriele Scholz since 1973. They have one child. Armin Mueller-Stahl was previously married to Monika Gabriel.
Gérard Pirès was born on August 31, 1942 in Paris, France. Gérard Pirès is a director and writer, known for Taxxi (1998), Erotissimo (1969) and Riders - Amici per la morte (2002).

Gillian Anderson was born in Chicago, Illinois, to Rosemary Alyce (Lane), a computer analyst, and Homer Edward Anderson III, who owned a film post-production company. Gillian Anderson started Gillian Anderson's career as a member of an amateur actor group while at high school. In 1987, Gillian Anderson's love of the theatre took Gillian Anderson to the National Theatre of Great Britain Summer Acting Programme held at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York. For several weeks Gillian Anderson studied under such National Theatre of Great Britain greats as Peter Chelsom, Bardy Thomas, and Michael Joyce. Afterwards, Gillian Anderson returned to the Goodman Theatre School at DePaul University in Chicago, Illinois where Gillian Anderson finished Gillian Anderson's education. Gillian Anderson's big break came with X-Files (1993) (with David Duchovny) as Dana Scully. There, Gillian Anderson met Gillian Anderson's future husband (Clyde Klotz), marrying on January 1st 1994. One month later, Gillian Anderson was pregnant. Gillian Anderson's daughter, Piper Anderson-Klotz, was born on the 25th September 1994. Gillian Anderson's film career started with the movie The Turning (1992) in 1997 and, the following year, Gillian Anderson starred in Scherzi del cuore (1998) with Sean Connery, Ellen Burstyn, Angelina Jolie and Dennis Quaid.

Daniel Edward Aykroyd was born on July 1, 1952 in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, to Lorraine Hélène (Gougeon), a secretary from a French-Canadian family, and Samuel Cuthbert Peter Hugh Aykroyd, a civil engineer who advised prime minister Pierre Trudeau. Daniel Edward Aykroyd attended Carleton University in 1969, where Daniel Edward Aykroyd majored in Criminology and Sociology, but Daniel Edward Aykroyd dropped out before completing Daniel Edward Aykroyd's degree. Daniel Edward Aykroyd worked as a comedian in various Canadian nightclubs and managed an after-hours speakeasy, Club 505, in Toronto for several years. Daniel Edward Aykroyd worked with Second City Stage Troupe in Toronto and started Daniel Edward Aykroyd's acting career at Carleton University with Sock'n'Buskin, the campus theater/drama club. Married to Donna Dixon since 1983, they have three daughters. Daniel Edward Aykroyd's parents are named Peter and Lorraine and Daniel Edward Aykroyd's brother Peter Aykroyd is a psychic researcher. Daniel Edward Aykroyd received an honorary Doctorate from Carleton University in 1994 and was made a Member of the Order of Canada in 1998.

Kevin Norwood Bacon was born on July 8, 1958 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, to Ruth Hilda (Holmes), an elementary school teacher, and Edmund Norwood Bacon, a prominent architect who was on the cover of Time Magazine in November Kevin Norwood Bacon's early training as an actor came from The Manning Street. Kevin Norwood Bacon's debut as the strict Chip Diller in Animal House (1978) almost seems like an inside joke, but Kevin Norwood Bacon managed to escape almost unnoticed from that role. A cena con gli amici (1982) became the turning point after a couple of television series and a number of less-than-memorable movie roles. In a cast of soon-to-be stars, Kevin Norwood Bacon more than held Kevin Norwood Bacon's end up, and we saw a glimpse of the real lunatic image of The Bacon. Kevin Norwood Bacon also starred in Footloose (1984), Un amore rinnovato (1988), Tremors (1990) with Fred Ward, Linea mortale (1990), and Apollo 13 (1995).Bacon is married to actress Kyra Sedgwick, with whom Kevin Norwood Bacon has 2 children.

Adrienne Jo Barbeau is an American actress and author best known for Adrienne Jo Barbeau's roles on the TV series Maude (1972) and in horror films, especially those directed by John Carpenter, with whom Adrienne Jo Barbeau was once married. Adrienne Jo Barbeau was born on June 11, 1945 in Sacramento, California, the daughter of an executive for Mobil Oil. Early on in Adrienne Jo Barbeau's career, Adrienne Jo Barbeau starred in Procedura ossessiva (1978), Fog (1980), 1997: fuga da New York (1981) and Il mostro della palude (1982), all John Carpenter, with whom she was once married-related projects. Adrienne Jo Barbeau has collaborated with George A. Romero on occasion, such as the Stephen King-scripted Creepshow (1982) and Due occhi diabolici (1990). Adrienne Jo Barbeau's work with other horror directors includes the Wes Craven comic book monster movie Il mostro della palude (1982). During the 1990s, Adrienne Jo Barbeau became best known for providing the voice of Catwoman on Batman (1992).

Luc Besson spent the first years of Luc Besson's life following Luc Besson's parents, scuba diving instructors, around the world. Luc Besson's early life was entirely aquatic. Luc Besson already showed amazing creativity as a youth, writing early drafts of Le grand bleu (1988) and Il quinto elemento (1997), as an adolescent bored in school. Luc Besson planned on becoming a marine biologist specializing in dolphins until a diving accident at age 17 which rendered Luc Besson unable to dive any longer. Luc Besson moved back to Paris, where Luc Besson was born, and only at age 18 did Luc Besson first have an urban life or television. Luc Besson realized that film was a medium which Luc Besson could combine all Luc Besson's interests in various arts together, so Luc Besson began taking odd jobs on various films. Luc Besson moved to America for three years, then returned to France and formed Les Films de Loups - Luc Besson's own production company, which later changed Les Films de Loups - his own production company, which later changed its name to Les Films de Dauphins's name to Les Films de Dauphins. Luc Besson is now able to dive again.

Yasmine Bleeth was born on June 14, 1968 in New York City, New York, USA as Yasmine Bleeth. Yasmine Bleeth is an actress, known for Baseketball (1998), Baywatch - Matrimonio alle Hawaii (2003) and La ragazza di Las Vegas (1998). Yasmine Bleeth has been married to Paul Cerrito since August 25, 2002.

Pierce Brendan Brosnan was born in Drogheda, County Louth, Ireland, to May (Smith), a nurse, and Thomas Brosnan, a carpenter. Pierce Brendan Brosnan lived in Navan, County Meath, until Pierce Brendan Brosnan moved to England, UK, at an early age (thus explaining Pierce Brendan Brosnan's ability to play men from both backgrounds convincingly). Pierce Brendan Brosnan's father left the household when Pierce Brendan Brosnan was a child and although reunited later in life, the two have never had a close relationship. Pierce Brendan Brosnan's most popular role is that of British secret agent James Bond. The death, in 1991, of Cassandra Harris, Pierce Brendan Brosnan's wife of eleven years, left Pierce Brendan Brosnan with three children - Christopher and Charlotte from Cassandra Harris, his wife of eleven years,'s first marriage and Sean from their marriage. Since Cassandra Harris, his wife of eleven years,'s death, Pierce Brendan Brosnan has had two children with Pierce Brendan Brosnan's second wife, Keely Shaye Brosnan.Pierce Brendan Brosnan is most famous for starring in the TV series Mai dire sì (1982) as the title character, as well as portraying British secret agent James Bond in GoldenEye (1995), Il domani non muore mai (1997), Il mondo non basta (1999) and La morte può attendere (2002).

Steve Buscemi was born in Brooklyn, New York, to Dorothy (Wilson), a restaurant hostess, and John Buscemi, a sanitation worker. Steve Buscemi is of Italian (father) and English, Dutch, and Irish (mother) descent. Steve Buscemi became interested in acting during Steve Buscemi's last year of high school. After graduating, Steve Buscemi moved to Manhattan to study acting with John Strasberg. Steve Buscemi began writing and performing original theatre pieces with fellow actor/writer Mark Boone Junior. This led to Steve Buscemi's being cast in Steve Buscemi's first lead role in Parting Glances (1986). Since then, Steve Buscemi has worked with many of the top filmmakers in Hollywood, including Quentin Tarantino, Jerry Bruckheimer, and The Coen Brothers. Steve Buscemi is a highly respected actor.

John Howard Carpenter was born in Carthage, New York, to mother Milton Jean (Carter) and father Howard Ralph Carpenter. John Howard Carpenter's family moved to Bowling Green, Kentucky, where John Howard Carpenter's father, a professor, was head of the music department at Western Kentucky University. John Howard Carpenter attended Western Kentucky University and then USC film school in Los Angeles. John Howard Carpenter began making short films in 1962, and won an Academy Award for Best Live-Action Short Subject in 1970, for The Resurrection of Broncho Billy (1970), which John Howard Carpenter made while at USC film school in Los Angeles. John Howard Carpenter formed a band in the mid-1970s called The Coupe de Villes, which included future directors Tommy Lee Wallace and Nick Castle. Since the 1970s, John Howard Carpenter has had numerous roles in the film industry including writer, actor, composer, producer, and director. After directing Dark Star (1974), John Howard Carpenter has helmed both classic horror films like Halloween - La notte delle streghe (1978), Fog (1980), and La cosa (1982), and noted sci-fi tales like 1997: fuga da New York (1981) and Starman (1984).

Bo Derek was born on November 20, 1956 in Long Beach, California, USA as Mary Cathleen Collins. Bo Derek is an actress and producer, known for Bolero extasy (1984), I fantasmi non possono farlo (1989) and Tommy Boy (1995). Bo Derek was previously married to John Derek.

Michael J. Fox was born Michael Andrew Fox on June 9, 1961 in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, to Phyllis Fox (née Piper), a payroll clerk, and William Fox. Michael J. Fox's parents moved Phyllis Fox (née Piper), a payroll clerk, and William Fox's 10-year-old son, Michael J. Fox's three sisters, Kelli Fox, Karen, and Jacki, and Michael J. Fox's brother Steven, to Vancouver, British Columbia, after Michael J. Fox's father, a sergeant in the Canadian Army Signal Corps, retired. During these years Michael J. Fox developed Michael J. Fox's desire to act. At 15 Michael J. Fox successfully auditioned for the role of a 10-year-old in a series called Leo and Me (1978). Gaining attention as a bright new star in Canadian television and movies, Michael J. Fox realized Michael J. Fox's love for acting when Michael J. Fox appeared on stage in "The Shadow Box." At 18 Michael J. Fox moved to Los Angeles and was offered a few television-series roles, but soon a few television-series roles stopped coming and Michael J. Fox was surviving on boxes of macaroni and cheese. Then Michael J. Fox's agent called to tell Michael J. Fox that Michael J. Fox got the part of Alex P. Keaton on the situation comedy Casa Keaton (1982). Michael J. Fox starred in the feature films Voglia di vincere (1985), Un liceo tutto matto (1983), Poison Ivy (1985) and Ritorno al futuro (1985).

Born in Salisbury, Maryland, USA, following high school Linda studied for two years at Washington College in Chestertown, Maryland, USA, before moving on to acting studies in New York. In New York Linda attended acting workshops given by Lee Strasberg. Linda's first parts were small parts in TV series, with Linda's biggest break coming with Linda's role in Terminator (1984). Most known to public at large from Linda's part in the TV series La bella e la bestia (1987) (before Terminator 2 - Il giorno del giudizio (1991), at least).

Anne Heche was born on May 25, 1969 in Aurora, Ohio, USA as Anne Heche. Anne Heche is an actress and writer, known for Sei giorni sette notti (1998), Donnie Brasco (1997) and Sesso & potere (1997). Anne Heche was previously married to Coleman 'Coley' Laffoon.

Dustin Lee Hoffman was born in Los Angeles, California, to Lillian (Gold) and Harry Hoffman, who was a furniture salesman and prop supervisor for Columbia Pictures. Dustin Lee Hoffman was raised in a Jewish family (from Ukraine, Russia-Poland, and Romania). Dustin Lee Hoffman graduated from Los Angeles High School in 1955, and went to Santa Monica City College, where Dustin Lee Hoffman dropped out after a year due to bad grades. But before Dustin Lee Hoffman did, Dustin Lee Hoffman took an acting course because Dustin Lee Hoffman was told that "nobody flunks acting." Also received some training at Los Angeles Conservatory of Music. Decided to go into acting because Dustin Lee Hoffman did not want to work or go into the service. Trained at The Pasadena Playhouse for two years.

Helen Hunt began studying acting at the age of eight with Helen Hunt's father, respected director and acting coach Gordon Hunt. A year later Helen Hunt made Helen Hunt's professional debut and afterwards worked steadily in films, theatre and television.

American actress and political activist Ashley Judd was born Ashley Tyler Ciminella on April 19, 1968, in Granada Hills, California. American actress and political activist Ashley Judd grew up in a family of successful performing artists as the daughter of country music singer Naomi Judd and the sister of Wynonna Judd. While American actress and political activist Ashley Judd is best known for an ongoing acting career spanning more than two decades, American actress and political activist Ashley Judd has increasingly become involved in global humanitarian efforts and political activism.

Heather Locklear was born on September 25, 1961 in Westwood, California, USA as Heather Locklear. Heather Locklear is an actress and producer, known for Melrose Place (1992), The Perfect Man (2005) and Il ritorno del mostro della palude (1989). Heather Locklear was previously married to Richie Sambora and Tommy Lee.

Alyssa Milano comes from an Italian-American family; Alyssa Milano's mother Lin Milano is a fashion designer and father Thomas Milano is a film music editor. Alyssa Milano was born in a working-class neighborhood in Brooklyn and grew up in a modest house on Staten Island. One day Alyssa Milano's babysitter, who was an aspiring dancer, dragged Alyssa Milano along to an open audition for the first national tour of "Annie". However, it was Alyssa Milano and not the sitter who was chosen from 1500 other girls for the role. So at the tender age of seven, with Alyssa Milano's mother in tow, Alyssa Milano joined the first national tour of "Annie" as July, one of the orphans. After 18 months on the road Alyssa Milano, left "Annie" to be featured in off-Broadway productions and television commercials. Then in 1983, at age 10, Alyssa Milano landed Alyssa Milano's breakthrough role on the sitcom Casalingo Superpiù (1984) as Tony Danza's saccharine sweet daughter, "Samantha Micelli", a kid whose native Brooklyn accent rivaled her TV dad's. In order for Alyssa Milano to accept the gig, an Italian-American family had to uproot and move 3,000 miles to Hollywood.

Michael John Myers was born in 1963 in Scarborough, Ontario, to Alice E. (Hind), an officer supervisor, and Eric Myers, an insurance agent. Michael John Myers's parents were both English, and had served in the Royal Air Force and British Army, respectively.Michael John Myers's television career really started in 1988, when Michael John Myers joined Il Saturday Night Live (1975), where Michael John Myers spent six seasons. Michael John Myers brought to life many memorable characters, such as Dieter and Wayne Cambell. Michael John Myers's major movies include Fusi di testa (1992), Fusi di testa 2 - Waynestock (1993), Mia moglie è una pazza assassina? (1993), the Austin Powers movies and Il gatto... e il cappello matto (2003).

Ryan Phillippe was born on September 10, 1974 in New Castle, Delaware, to Susan (Thomas), a nurse, and Richard Phillippe, a chemical technician. Ryan Phillippe has three sisters, Kirsten, Lindsay, and Katelyn, and attended New Castle Baptist Academy. Ryan Phillippe's acting career began with the soap opera Una vita da vivere (1968). It was no small role. Ryan Phillippe's character, Billy Douglas, was US daytime television's first gay teenager. His character, Billy Douglas struggled with coming out issues and the town's anti-gay reactions. After several other television appearances and Ryan Phillippe began appearing in movies of Ryan Phillippe's own, Ecstasy Generation (1997), L'Albatross - Oltre la tempesta (1996) So cosa hai fatto (1997), Cruel Intentions - Prima regola non innamorarsi (1999), Crash (2005), Flags of Our Fathers (2006), and Stop-Loss (2008).

Parker Posey was born two months premature in Baltimore, Maryland, to Lynda (Patton) and Chris Posey. The family moved to Monroe, La. and then Laurel, Mississippi, where Chris Posey became owner of Laurel, Mississippi, where Chris became owner of Laurel's own Posey Chevrolet's own Posey Chevrolet. Parker Posey attended high school at R. H. Watkins High School in Laurel, Mississippi, where Chris became owner of Laurel's own Posey Chevrolet, and college at the prestigious SUNY Purchase. While at the prestigious SUNY Purchase Parker Posey roomed with Sherry Stringfield of TV's E.R. - Medici in prima linea (1994).

Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci was born in 1980 in Santa Monica, California, the youngest of four children of Sarah (Murdoch), a realtor, and Ralph Ricci, a lawyer and therapist. Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci is of Italian (from Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci's paternal grandfather), Irish, and Scots-Irish descent. Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci made Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci's screen debut at the age of 9 in Sirene (1990), in which Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci worked with Winona Ryder and Cher. Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci's breakthrough adult role was in Tempesta di ghiaccio (1997), in which Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci plays a nymphet who skillfully seduces two brothers. Precocious, outspoken child-teen starlet of the 1990s, Christina Ricci worked with Johnny Depp and Casper Van Dien in the Tim Burton film Il mistero di Sleepy Hollow (1999).

Molly Ringwald was born in Roseville, California, to Adele Edith (Frembd), a chef, and Robert Ringwald, a blind jazz pianist. Molly Ringwald's ancestry includes German, English, and Swedish. The most internationally acclaimed Spanish filmmaker since Luis Buñuel was born in a small town (Calzada de Calatrava) in the impoverished Spanish region of La Mancha. A. Jean-Jacques Annaud is a French film director, screenwriter and producer, best known for directing La guerra del fuoco (1981), Il nome della rosa (1986), L'amante (1992), Sette anni in Tibet (1997) and L'ultimo lupo (2015). Anwar's father is Tariq Anwar and Anwar's mother is Shireen Anwar. Anwar attended Laleham Church of England Primary and Middle School from 1975 to 1982. Born in Chicago, Oscar nominee, Golden Globe and Emmy winner Tom Berenger was raised in a working class home as the son of a printer for the Chicago Sun-Times. Michael Connell Biehn was born on July 31, 1956 in Anniston, Alabama, to Marcia (Connell) and Don Biehn, a lawyer. Mel Brooks was born Melvin Kaminsky on June 28, 1926 in Brooklyn, New York. Mel Brooks served in WWII, and afterwards got a job playing the drums at nightclubs in the Catskills. Yancy Butler was born and grew up in Greenwich Village, New York City during the 1970s, so it's not unusual that Yancy Butler chose to be an actor, being third generation showbiz. Chevy Chase was born Cornelius Crane Chase in Lower Manhattan, New York, to Cathalene Parker (Browning), a concert pianist and librettist, and Edward Tinsley "Ned" Chase, an editor and writer. Cindy Crawford was born on February 20, 1966 in DeKalb, Illinois, USA as Cynthia Ann Crawford. Born in Los Angeles but raised in Manhattan and educated at Middlebury College and Carnegie-Mellon University, James Cromwell is the son of film director John Cromwell and actress Kay Johnson. James Cromwell started appearing on television in 1974, gaining some notice in a recurring role as Archie Bunker's friend Stretch Cunningham on Arcibaldo (1971), made James Cromwell's film debut in 1976, and goes back to the stage periodically. Confidential (1997).

Donna D'Errico was born on March 30, 1968 in Dothan, Alabama, USA as Donna Jeanette D'Errico. Donna D'Errico is an actress and director, known for 116 MacDougal, Only God Can (2015) and Sorvegliati in casa (2018). Donna D'Errico was previously married to Nikki Sixx.

Initially not a science fiction fan, theatre actor Anthony Daniels was persuaded by theatre actor Anthony Daniels's agent to meet George Lucas for the casting of C-3PO in Guerre stellari (1977). theatre actor Anthony Daniels went on to perform C-3PO, both theatre actor Anthony Daniels's voice and body in the suit, for all the episodic Star Wars films produced. Lolita Davidovich was born on July 15, 1961 in London, Ontario, Canada as Lolita Davidovich. Lolita Davidovich is an actress, known for Hollywood Homicide (2003), Scandalo Blaze (1989) and Tutto quella notte (1987). Lolita Davidovich has been married to Ron Shelton since 1997. They have one child.

(1971), Beato tra le donne (1970) and Louis de Funes e il nonno surgelato (1969). Olivier De Funès has been married to Dominique Watrin since 1977. They have three children.

Brian De Palma is the son of a surgeon. Brian De Palma studied physics but at the same time felt Brian De Palma's dedication for the movies and made some short films. Julie Delpy was born in Paris, France, in 1969 to Albert Delpy and Marie Pillet, both actors.Julie Delpy was first featured in Jean-Luc Godard's Détective (1985) at the age of fourteen. Julie Delpy is a resident of Los Angeles.

Gérard Depardieu was born in Châteauroux, Indre, France, to Anne Jeanne Josèphe (Marillier) and René Maxime Lionel Depardieu, who was a metal worker and fireman. Young delinquent and wanderer in the past, Gérard Depardieu started Gérard Depardieu's acting career at the small traveling theatre "Cafe de la Gare", along with Patrick Dewaere and Miou-Miou. After minor roles in cinema, at last, Gérard Depardieu got Gérard Depardieu's chance in Bertrand Blier's I santissimi (1974). Bertrand Blier's I santissimi (1974) established a new type of hero in the French cinema and Gérard Depardieu's popularity grew enormously. Later, Gérard Depardieu diversified Gérard Depardieu's screen image and became the leading French actor of the 80s and 90s. Gérard Depardieu was twice awarded a César as Best Actor for L'ultimo metrò (1980) and Cyrano di Bergerac (1990), also received an Oscar nomination for Cyrano di Bergerac and a number of awards at international film festivals. In 1996, Gérard Depardieu was distinguished by the highest French title of "Chevalier du Légion d'Honneur". Ami Dolenz was born on January 8, 1969 in Burbank, California, USA as Ami Dolenz. Ami Dolenz is an actress and producer, known for Playboy in prova (1987), Miracolo a Santa Monica (1992) and General Hospital (1963). Ami Dolenz has been married to Jerry Trimble since August 10, 2002.

Award winning Actor Amanda Donohoe trained at the Royal Central school of Speech and Drama. Michael Dorn was born on December 9, 1952 in Luling, Texas, USA as Michiel Dorn. Michael Dorn is an actor and director, known for Primo contatto (1996), Star Trek - L'insurrezione (1998) and Star Trek - La nemesi (2002).

Francine Joy Drescher was born on September 30, 1957 in Flushing, Queens, New York, to Sylvia Drescher, a bridal consultant, and Mort Drescher, a naval systems analyst. Fran, as Francine Joy Drescher is called, attended Hillcrest High School in New York with another now-famous name, Ray Romano. Francine Joy Drescher was a studious girl and was quite popular. In fact, at age fifteen, Francine Joy Drescher'd met the man Francine Joy Drescher thought Francine Joy Drescher'd spend the rest of Francine Joy Drescher's life with. the man she thought she'd spend the rest of her life with was Peter Marc Jacobson. Francine Joy Drescher's first break was in the unforgettable movie, La febbre del sabato sera (1977) with John Travolta. Francine Joy Drescher continued to play small roles in movies, until Francine Joy Drescher came up with the idea for La tata (1993). Francine Joy Drescher was visiting a friend in England and came up with the plot line. La tata (1993) became an instant success, and so did Francine Joy Drescher. Since then, Francine Joy Drescher has been in films such as L'amore è un trucco (1997) (which Francine Joy Drescher also produced) and Ho solo fatto a pezzi mia moglie (2000) co-starring Woody Allen. Born in Egypt to Armenian parents, he was raised in Western Canada. Both his parents were painters, and he planned to be a playwright, but after making a short film, he became hooked on telling stories visually. Returned to ethnic "homeland" when he filmed Calendar (1993) in Armenia. Won attention at the Sundance Film Festival for earlier work, then broke through critically and commercially with Exotica (1994). Afterwards, Il dolce domani (1997) led him to receive two Academy Award nominations, and then Chloe - Tra seduzione e inganno (2009) became his biggest moneymaker ever (after Chloe - Tra seduzione e inganno (2009)'s DVD/Blu-ray release).

Jennifer Ehle was born on December 29, 1969 in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, USA as Jennifer Ehle. This director seems to shine most when making movies that can best be described as part action movies/part disaster movies.Beginning with Outbreak (1995) about the outbreak of a killer virus. Fred Savage was later in the movie Viceversa, due vite scambiate (1988) with Judge Reinhold and then in Piccoli mostri (1989), in which Fred Savage worked with Fred Savage's younger brother Ben Savage. Then, Fred Savage went into the movie Il piccolo grande mago dei videogames (1989), with Luke Edwards, Christian Slater, Jenny Lewis, and Beau Bridges. the series The Wonder Years (1988) was canceled while Fred Savage's younger brother Ben Savage got the lead in the show Crescere che fatica (1993). Fred Savage stopped working for a couple of years until Fred Savage was cast in the series Working (1997).

Greta Scacchi was born in Milan, Italy, to Pamela Carsaniga, an English dancer and Luca Scacchi, an Italian art dealer and painter. Greta Scacchi grew up in Milan, Italy and Sussex, England. In 1975, Greta Scacchi's mother and second husband moved to Australia, where, after Greta Scacchi left school, Greta Scacchi worked as an Italian interpreter on a ranch. At age 18, Greta Scacchi returned to England and trained at the Bristol Old Vic, paying Greta Scacchi's way through college by working as a model for catalogues. Played small parts as a stage actress before Greta Scacchi made Greta Scacchi's first appearance on British television, then the young film maker Dominik Graf directed Greta Scacchi in La moglie... gli uccelli (1982). Greta Scacchi learned German for this movie. (Greta Scacchi also speaks fluent Italian and French.) After Calore e polvere (1983), Greta Scacchi played parts in French, Italian and English movies and Australian television, working with the Taviani Brothers, Margareta von Trotta and Diana Kurys. Greta Scacchi turned down Hollywood for many years but after appearing in Misfatto bianco (1987) agreed to co-star in Presunto innocente (1990), Prova schiacciante (1991) and I protagonisti (1992).

Claudia Schiffer was born on August 25, 1970 in Rheinberg, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. Claudia Schiffer is an actress and producer, known for Love Actually - L'amore davvero (2003), Kingsman: Secret Service (2014) and Richie Rich - Il più ricco del mondo (1994). Claudia Schiffer has been married to Matthew Vaughn since May 25, 2002. They have three children.

Liev (pronounced Lee-ev) Schreiber was born in San Francisco. Liev's mother, Heather (Milgram), is a painter, and Liev's father, Tell Schreiber (Tell Carroll Schreiber III), is a theatrical actor who had a small role in The keeper: il custode (1976). Liev's mother is from a working-class Jewish family from Poland and Russia, while Liev's father is from an upper-class Protestant family. Liev's parents moved the family to Canada when Liev was one, and divorced when Liev was five. Liev and Liev's mother moved to New York, where His mother, Heather (Milgram), drove a cab. During that time, He and his mother lived as squatters in abandoned buildings. Liev's mother taught Liev to read, and His mother, Heather (Milgram), also forbade Liev from seeing color movies. Liev grew up seeing silent and black & white movies at a local revival house and particularly enjoyed those of Charles Chaplin. Liev's mother now lives in an ashram in Virginia. Liev began acting at Hampshire College and continued at the Yale University School of Drama in 1992. Liev originally wanted to be a playwright, but Liev's teacher encouraged Liev to become an actor.

Thomas William Selleck is an American actor and film producer, known for Thomas William Selleck's starring role as Hawaii-based private investigator "Thomas Magnum" on the 1980s television series, Magnum P.I. (1980).Selleck was born in Detroit, Michigan, to Martha S. (Jagger), a homemaker, and Robert Dean Selleck, a real estate investor and executive. Thomas William Selleck is of mostly English descent, including recent immigrant ancestors.Thomas William Selleck has appeared extensively on television in roles such as "Dr. Richard Burke" on Friends (1994) and "A.J. Cooper" on Las Vegas (2003). In addition to Thomas William Selleck's series work, Thomas William Selleck has appeared in more than fifty made-for-TV and general release movies, including Campione... per forza! (1992), Carabina Quigley (1990), Lassiter, lo scassinatore (1984) and, Thomas William Selleck's most successful movie release, Tre scapoli e un bebè (1987), which was the highest grossing movie in Thomas William Selleck also plays "Jesse Stone" in a series of made-for-TV movies, based on the Robert B. Parker novels. In 2010, Thomas William Selleck appears as "Commissioner Frank Reagan" in the drama series, Blue Bloods (2010) on CBS.

Born in New York City, Tupac grew up primarily in Harlem. In 1984, Tupac's family moved to Baltimore, Maryland where Tupac became good friends with Jada Pinkett Smith. Tupac's family moved again in 1988 to Oakland, California. Tupac's first breakthrough in music came in the same year as a member of the group Digital Underground. In the same year Tupac received individual recognition for Tupac's album "2Pacalypse Now," but this album was also the beginning of Tupac's notoriety as a leading figure of the gangster permutation of hip-hop, with references to cop killing and sexual violence. Tupac's solo movie career also began in the same year with Juice (1992), and in 1992 Tupac co-starred with Janet Jackson in Poetic Justice (1993).However, law confrontations were soon to come: A 15-day jail term in 1994 for assault and battery and, in 1995, a conviction for sexual assault of a female fan. After serving 8 months pending an appeal, Tupac was released from jail.

Marina Sirtis was born in London, England, to Greek parents, Despina (Yianniri), a tailor's assistant, and John Sirtis. Marina Sirtis's parents did not want Marina Sirtis to become an actress. As soon as Marina Sirtis completed high school, Marina Sirtis secretly applied to the Guildhall School of Music and Drama. After Marina Sirtis's graduation, Marina Sirtis worked in musical theater, repertory and television. In 1986, Marina Sirtis moved to Los Angeles, California to boost Marina Sirtis's career. For six months, Marina Sirtis auditioned for roles but was unsuccessful. Just before Marina Sirtis planned to go back home, Marina Sirtis got the role of Counselor Deanna Troi on Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987). After the series ended, Marina Sirtis reprised Marina Sirtis's role for a string of successful Star Trek films: Generazioni (1994), Primo contatto (1996), Star Trek - L'insurrezione (1998), and Star Trek - La nemesi (2002). In 1992, Marina Sirtis married rock guitarist Michael Lamper. Marina Sirtis occasionally attends Star Trek conventions so that Marina Sirtis's loving fans can meet Marina Sirtis, and Marina Sirtis can meet her loving fans.

Anna Nicole Smith was born on November 28, 1967 in Houston, Texas, USA as Vickie Lynn Hogan. Anna Nicole Smith is known for Anna Nicole Smith's work on Una pallottola spuntata 33 1/3 - L'insulto finale (1994), Be Cool (2005) and Illegal Aliens (2007). Anna Nicole Smith was married to J. Howard Marshall II and Billy Smith. Anna Nicole Smith died on February 8, 2007 in Hollywood, Florida, USA.

'Alan Smithee' is a common pseudonym for directors whose film was clearly taken away from her/him and recut heavily against her/his wishes in ways that completely altered directors whose film was clearly taken away from her/him and recut heavily against her/his wishes in ways that completely altered the film.The Directors Guild contract generally does not permit a director to remove her/his name from films. Directors Guild has been striving for decades to establish the director as the "author" of a film, and part of getting the credit for the successes is taking the blame for the failures. The only exceptions Directors Guild make are cases in which a film was clearly taken away from a director and recut heavily against a director's wishes in ways that completely altered a film. Directors are required to the appeal to Directors Guild in such cases. If the appeal is successful, Directors's name is replaced by Alan Smithee. So if you notice a film directed by Alan Smithee, it is certain a film directed by Alan Smithee is not what a film directed by Alan Smithee's director intended, and likely that a film directed by Alan Smithee is not any good.

Born to a Puerto Rican family in Brooklyn, Talisa was raised there and in Massachusetts. Talisa started modeling at age 15 and has appeared on the covers of "Vogue," "Mademoiselle," "Glamour," and "Self," as well as in a "Sports Illustrated" swimsuit issue. Talisa has been making film appearances since 1988, beginning with Spike of Bensonhurst (1988).

Terence Henry Stamp was born and lived in Canal Road, Bow, until German bombers forced Terence Henry Stamp's family to move to Plaistow. An icon of the 1960s, Terence Henry Stamp dated the likes of Julie Christie, Brigitte Bardot and Jean Shrimpton. After an extremely successful early career, starring in Modesty Blaise: La bellissima che uccide (1966), Poor Cow (1967) and Via dalla pazza folla (1967), Terence Henry Stamp withdrew from mainstream films after Terence Henry Stamp's girlfriend, supermodel Jean Shrimpton, left Terence Henry Stamp, and Terence Henry Stamp and went on a 10-year sabbatical in India. Terence Henry Stamp returned home in the late 1970s to star as the evil General Zod in Superman II (1980), and in 1984, delivered what many consider Terence Henry Stamp's finest performance as the supergrass in Stephen Frears' Vendetta (1984). A few minor but colourful roles, topped by Terence Henry Stamp's performance as the transsexual Bernadette in Priscilla - La regina del deserto (1994), have put Terence Henry Stamp back in the British consciousness. Terence Henry Stamp's role of a vengeful gangster in L'inglese (1999) was created especially for Terence Henry Stamp by its director.

Madeleine Stowe was born in Los Angeles, California, to Mireya Maria (Mora Steinvorth) and Robert Alfred Stowe, a civil engineer. Madeleine Stowe's mother was a from a prominent political family in Costa Rica. Madeleine Stowe grew up in Eagle Rock, a working-class neighborhood of Los Angeles, California. At age ten Madeleine Stowe started practicing for a career as a concert pianist and trained every day for hours. However, when Madeleine Stowe's instructor died in 1976 Madeleine Stowe more or less quit playing.Madeleine Stowe went to University of Southern California and studied cinema and journalism before taking up acting at Beverly Hills' Solaris Theater. Madeleine Stowe made a few appearances in TV and on film but Madeleine Stowe's breakthrough came in 1987 with Sorveglianza... speciale (1987). Other major credits include L'ultimo dei Mohicani (1992) and America oggi (1993).When not filming, Madeleine Stowe spends Madeleine Stowe's time at Madeleine Stowe's ranch in Texas, which Madeleine Stowe shares with Madeleine Stowe's husband Brian Benben.

Tami is half-Scottish (father) and half-Israeli (mother). Tami's father, Professor David Stronach, was a notable expert on Persian antiquities. The family had to flee Persia/Iran during the Revolution. The family went to Israel, then to America where Tami is still based. Tami was studying acting in California when Tami was chosen for Tami's role as the child-like Empress. Tami has been a dancer throughout Tami's life and has opted for a dancer as Tami's main career though Tami has recently returned to acting. Tami has been heavily involved in the Neta Dance Troop. Tami speaks several languages including English and Hebrew.

Daniel Bernard Sweeney was born on November 14, 1961 in Shoreham, Long Island, New York. Daniel Bernard Sweeney got Daniel Bernard Sweeney's start in the New York theatre with appearances in dozens of productions including a run on Broadway in "The Caine Mutiny Court Martial". Daniel Bernard Sweeney was selected by Francis Ford Coppola to star in the Vietnam era drama Giardini di pietra (1987). This began a string of performances including Shoeless Joe Jackson in Otto uomini fuori (1988), Dish Boggett in Colomba solitaria (1989), Travis Walton in Bagliori nel buio (1993), and as Doug Dorsey the hockey player turned figure skater in the classic romantic comedy Vincere insieme (1992). Daniel Bernard Sweeney's television work includes Strange Luck (1995), C-16: FBI (1997) and Harsh Realm (1999) with appearances in Jericho (2006), Crash (2008), The Event (2010), and the Emmy-winning Rose White (1992). Daniel Bernard Sweeney recently migrated to the other side of the camera to produce, direct and co-write the cult film Two Tickets to Paradise (2006) which won over a dozen awards at major film festivals.

David Thewlis was born David Wheeler in 1963 in Blackpool, Lancashire, to Maureen (Thewlis) and Alec Raymond Wheeler, and lived with David Thewlis's parents above Maureen (Thewlis) and Alec Raymond Wheeler's combination wallpaper and toy shop during David Thewlis's childhood. Originally, David Thewlis came to London with David Thewlis's band Door 66, however David Thewlis changed David Thewlis's plans and entered Guildhall School of Drama.David Thewlis had minor roles in films and TV until David Thewlis took the main role in Naked - Nudo (1993). Naked - Nudo (1993) won David Thewlis several awards including the New York Critics Award. David Thewlis has since been in many other films including Dragonheart (1996), Restoration - Il peccato e il castigo (1995), Black Beauty (1994) and David Thewlis took the part of Professor Remus John Lupin in Harry Potter e il prigioniero di Azkaban (2004) and it's sequels.Recently, David Thewlis starred in the third season of FX's Fargo (2014).He lived with the British actress Anna Friel from 2001-2010. They have a daughter, Gracie Ellen Mary, born July 9, 2005.

Fred Thompson was born on August 19, 1942 in Sheffield, Alabama, USA as Freddie Dalton Thompson. Fred Thompson was an actor, known for Caccia a Ottobre Rosso (1990), Senza via di scampo (1987) and Sinister (2012). Fred Thompson was married to Jeri Kehn Thompson and Sarah Elizabeth Lindsey. Fred Thompson died on November 1, 2015 in Nashville, Tennessee, USA.

Meg Tilly was set on being a dancer, and at 17 connected to the Connecticut Ballet Company and later Throne Dance Theatre. It was in this capacity that Meg Tilly had Meg Tilly's screen debut in Alan Parker's Saranno famosi (1980). Unfortunately, an injury to Meg Tilly's back cut short Meg Tilly's plans for a dance career, and a small appearance in the TV series Hill Street giorno e notte (1981) turned Meg Tilly towards acting (Meg Tilly's dancing skills were not all forgotten, as was evident in Il grande freddo (1983) and Psycho II (1983)). Meg Tilly received an Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Actress for Agnese di Dio (1985), and nobody doubted that Meg Tilly was on Meg Tilly's way to stardom. One step on the road to stardom was Meg Tilly's being cast in Milos Forman's Amadeus (1984) as Constanza, but again Meg Tilly's body interfered, and seven weeks into the production with Meg Tilly's foot in a cast were more than the producers could accept, and Meg Tilly was replaced. Meg Tilly's "consolation", was a role in Milos Forman's's next project Valmont (1989), didn't do Meg Tilly's career much good. Since then Meg Tilly has averaged a movie a year, and with the exception of Fuga per un sogno (1992), none have tapped the enormous reservoir of talent Meg Tilly has.

Tamlyn Tomita was born on January 27, 1966 in Okinawa, Japan as Tamlyn Naomi Tomita. Tamlyn Tomita is an actress, known for The Day After Tomorrow - L'alba del giorno dopo (2004), The Eye (2008) and Karate Kid II - La storia continua... (1986).

Robin Tunney studied acting at the Chicago Academy for the Arts, spending Robin Tunney's summer performing in such plays as "Bus Stop" and "Agnes of God". Robin Tunney moved to Los Angeles at the age of eighteen and shortly landed roles in such television shows as Una famiglia come tante (1989), Class of '96 (1993) (recurring), Law & Order - I due volti della giustizia (1990), HBO's Dream On (1990) and the ABC mini-series J.F.K.: Reckless Youth (1993), in which Robin Tunney played "Kit Kennedy". Giovani streghe (1996) was Robin Tunney's first film lead though Robin Tunney has appeared in many supporting roles.

Kathleen Turner was born June 19, 1954 in Springfield, Missouri, to Patsy (Magee) and Allen Richard Turner, a U.S. Foreign Service officer. Kathleen Turner graduated from American School in London in 1972. After the death of Kathleen Turner's father, the Turner family moved back to the United States where Kathleen Turner later enrolled at Missouri State University for two years, and earned Kathleen Turner's Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the University of Maryland Baltimore County (UMBC) in 1977. Kathleen Turner made Kathleen Turner's film debut in Brivido caldo (1981), Kathleen Turner's role as the relentless Matty Waker brought Kathleen Turner's astronomical success, and is remembered as one of the sexiest roles in film history. After Kathleen Turner's initial success, Kathleen Turner continued to flourish with performances in Ho perso la testa per un cervello (1983), All'inseguimento della pietra verde (1984), Il gioiello del Nilo (1985), L'onore dei Prizzi (1985), Peggy Sue si è sposata (1986), La guerra dei Roses (1989), and La signora ammazzatutti (1994).

Deborah Kara Unger was the first Canadian accepted into the prestigious Australian National Institute of Dramatic Art. Deborah Kara Unger made Deborah Kara Unger's feature film debut in Giuramento di sangue (1990), followed by roles in Christopher Crowe's Perversione mortale (1992), L'ultimo carico d'oro (1991), and Highlander 3 (1994). Deborah Kara Unger acted in the award-winning television drama Bangkok Hilton (1989) with Nicole Kidman and Denholm Elliott, as well as HBO's Hotel Room (1993), directed by James Signorelli, and Showtime's ensemble medical drama State of Emergency (1994).
Nana Visitor was born on July 26, 1957 in New York City, New York, USA as Nana Tucker. Nana Visitor is an actress, known for Star Trek: Deep Space Nine (1993), Venerdì 13 (2009) and Ted 2 (2015).

Jon Voight was born on December 29, 1938 in Yonkers, New York, USA as Jonathan Vincent Voight. Jon Voight is an actor, known for Un uomo da marciapiede (1969), Anaconda (1997) and Un tranquillo weekend di paura (1972). Jon Voight was previously married to Marcheline Bertrand and Lauri Peters.

J.T. Walsh was born on September 28, 1943 in San Francisco, California, USA as J.T. Walsh. J.T. Walsh was an actor, known for Lama tagliente (1996), Breakdown - La trappola (1997) and Good Morning, Vietnam (1987). J.T. Walsh was married to Susan West. J.T. Walsh died on February 27, 1998 in La Mesa, California, USA.

Julie grew up on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. Julie's father, Neil Warner, was a musical arranger, who wrote jingles for products such as Tic-Tacs and Fig Newtons. Julie's mother, Naomi, is a freelance book agent. A 10-years younger brother, James, works for the New York City Parks Department. At 12, Julie attended the exclusive Dalton School, where Julie became friends with Mary Stuart Masterson. While there, an agent urged Julie to try out for a role in the movie Pretty Baby (1978). Julie didn't get a role in the movie Pretty Baby (1978), but a role in the movie Pretty Baby (1978) did lead to a role on the soap Sentieri (1952). Julie majored in theatre arts at Brown University and graduated in 1987. Julie worked as a waitress in Los Angeles, while seeking Julie's acting break. In 1995, Julie married writer-director Jonathan Prince.

Growing up in Baltimore in the 1950s, John Waters was not like other children; John Waters was obsessed by violence and gore, both real and on the screen. With John Waters's weird counter-culture friends as John Waters's cast, John Waters began making silent 8mm and 16mm films in the mid-'60s; John Waters screened silent 8mm and 16mm films in rented Baltimore church halls to underground audiences drawn by word of mouth and street leafleting campaigns. As John Waters's filmmaking grew more polished and John Waters's subject matter more shocking, John Waters's audiences grew bigger, and John Waters's write-ups in the Baltimore papers more outraged. By the early 1970s John Waters was making features, which John Waters managed to get shown in midnight screenings in art cinemas by sheer perseverance. Success came when Pink Flamingos (1972) - a deliberate exercise in ultra-bad taste - took off in 1973, helped no doubt by lead actor Divine's infamous dog-crap eating scene.John Waters continued to make low-budget shocking movies with John Waters's Dreamland repertory company until Hollywood crossover success came with Grasso è bello (1988), and although John Waters's movies nowadays might now appear cleaned up and professional, his movies retain John Waters's playfulness, and reflect John Waters's lifelong obsessions.

Wil Wheaton was born Richard William Wheaton III on July 29, 1972 in Burbank, California. Wil Wheaton first gained international attention by starring in the Rob Reiner comedy-drama film Stand by Me - Ricordo di un'estate (1986). Wil Wheaton then played Wesley Crusher on the television series Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987) for three and one-quarter seasons. Wil Wheaton left the Hollywood scene for 18 months to pursue personal video production. Wil Wheaton did return to "Star Trek" every now and then for an occasional episode, however. Wil Wheaton then returned to Los Angeles, California, attended acting school for five years and now works on many projects. Wil Wheaton lives in Arcadia, California with Wil Wheaton's wife Anne and his wife Anne's two sons.

BD Wong was born and raised in San Francisco, California. BD Wong made BD Wong's Broadway debut in "M. Butterfly." BD Wong is the only actor to be honored with the Tony Award, Drama Desk Award, Outer Critics Circle Award, Clarence Derwent Award, and Theater World Award for the same performance. BD Wong starred in the television series All-American Girl (1994), and has made guest appearances on Sesamo apriti (1969) and X-Files (1993). BD Wong was in the off-Broadway musical revival of "As Thousands Cheer" and followed with a critically acclaimed performance as "Linus" in the revival of "You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown," returned to SVU, and is now starring in the revival of Stephen Sondheim's "Pacific Overtures."

A whiz-kid with special effects, Robert is from the Spielberg camp of film-making (Steven Spielberg produced many of Robert's films). Usually working with writing partner Bob Gale, Robert's earlier films show Robert has a talent for zany comedy (All'inseguimento della pietra verde (1984), 1941 - Allarme a Hollywood (1979)) and special effect vehicles (Chi ha incastrato Roger Rabbit (1988) and Ritorno al futuro (1985)). Robert's later films have become more serious, with the hugely successful Tom Hanks vehicle Forrest Gump (1994) and the Jodie Foster film Contact (1997), both critically acclaimed movies. Again, His later films incorporate stunning effects. Robert has proved Robert can work a serious story around great effects.

Joel Oliansky was born on October 11, 1935 in New York City, New York, USA. Joel Oliansky was a writer and director, known for The Law (1975), The Bold Ones: The Senator (1970) and Masada (1981). Joel Oliansky was married to Patricia E. Godfrey. Joel Oliansky died on July 29, 2002 in Los Angeles, California, USA.

After becoming an award-winning, platinum-selling writer, producer/director Willie Aames took a 5-year hiatus and became a 6-star cruise director spending Willie Aames's time circling the globe and visiting over 127 countries. Recently Willie Aames returned to Willie Aames's roots in acting and film making, splitting Willie Aames's time between Los Angeles and Vancouver, BC, with Willie Aames's wife, Winnie Hung. Willie Aames has two children, Christopher and Harleigh.

Secondary to studying performing arts as American University in Washington, D.C., Aaron made Aaron's debut in motion pictures with a small part in Robert Altman's Jimmy Dean, Jimmy Dean (1982). Since, Aaron has built Aaron acting career as a character actress, and continues to work with some of cinema's most significant directors; particularly, Woody Allen and Mike Nichols.

Paula Abdul grew up in the San Fernando Valley, California. Paula Abdul began taking dance lessons when Paula Abdul was eight. Paula Abdul attended Van Nuys High School, where Paula Abdul was senior class president and head cheerleader. After graduating in 1980, Paula Abdul started college at Cal State-Northridge, majoring in TV and radio. After joining the L.A. Lakers cheerleaders, Paula Abdul became head cheerleader/choreographer after only a few months, eventually dropping out of college to dance and choreograph full-time. Paula Abdul was recruited by The Jacksons to choreograph The Jacksons's 1984 "Torture" video, the first in a long list of videos and movies Paula Abdul would choreograph. Paula Abdul branched out into singing with Paula Abdul's first CD, "Forever Your Girl", which had lackluster sales until the single "Straight Up" exploded onto the charts in December 1988 and Paula Abdul has been a popular singer/dancer ever since, enhanced by Paula Abdul's stint as a judge on the hit series American Idol: The Search for a Superstar (2002).

Legendary US NBA basketball player with the Milwaukee Bucks (1969-1975) and the Los Angeles Lakers (1975-1989), the 7' 2" Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (born Lew Alcindor) has made numerous guest appearances on US TV shows including L'uomo di Atlantide (1977), 21 Jump Street (1987), Un salto nel buio (1983) and Scrubs: Medici ai primi ferri (2001).However, the 7' 2" Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (born Lew Alcindor)'s best known to film audiences for two very different film roles. Firstly, as a very tall adversary to Bruce Lee during a rather unique fight sequence in Bruce Lee's final film L'ultimo combattimento di Chen (1978), and then the 7' 2" Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (born Lew Alcindor) played an airline pilot with a remarkable similarity to "Kareem Abdul-Jabbar" in the hilarious L'aereo più pazzo del mondo (1980).

Jim Abrahams was born on May 10, 1944 in Shorewood, Wisconsin, USA. Jim Abrahams is a writer and producer, known for L'aereo più pazzo del mondo (1980), Top Secret! (1984) and Hot Shots! (1991). Jim Abrahams is married to Nancy Cocuzzo.

This Spanish actress started studying dancing. This Spanish actress's teacher encouraged This Spanish actress to participate in This Spanish actress's first film Obsesión (1977). After that, This Spanish actress was chosen by the director Narciso Ibáñez Serrador to be one of the co-hostesses of the famous TV contest Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez (1972) becoming very well known all over Spain. Since 1975 This Spanish actress also made several films in France and Italy. In Spain, This Spanish actress had This Spanish actress's first success with La muchacha de las bragas de oro (1980), directed by Vicente Aranda. This Spanish actress has won twice the Best Actress Award at the San Sebastial Film Festival for El lute, o cammina o schiatta (1987) and for Nessuno parlerà di noi (1995). In 1991 This Spanish actress won the Silver Bear at Berlin Film Festival for This Spanish actress's work in Amantes - Amanti (1991).

Joey Lauren Adams was born on January 9, 1968 in Little Rock, Arkansas, USA. Joey Lauren Adams is an actress, known for In cerca di Amy (1997), La vita è un sogno (1993) and Big Daddy - Un papà speciale (1999). Joey Lauren Adams has been married to Brian Vilim since June 7, 2014.

Stunning Swedish born ex-model who broke into film in 1970, and quickly appeared in several high profile films including playing the ex-wife of James Caan in the futuristic Rollerball (1975) and the ill-fated lover of super-assassin Francisco Scaramanga played by Christopher Lee in Agente 007 - L'uomo dalla pistola d'oro (1974). To date, the beautiful Maud Adams has appeared in three James Bond films... the other two performances were as one of the lead villains in Octopussy - Operazione piovra (1983) and as an extra in 007 - Bersaglio mobile (1985). the beautiful Maud Adams has appeared in numerous television specials on the Bond series of films, and also played the love interest of crazy Bruce Dern in Tattoo: il segno della passione (1981). In the late 1990s, the beautiful Maud Adams had a regular role on a Swedish soap opera; however, the beautiful Maud Adams has not been seen on cinema screens since late 1996.

John Agar was born in Chicago, the eldest of four children. In World War II, Sgt. John Agar was a United States Army Air Force physical instructor. John Agar's 1945 marriage at the Wilshire Memorial Church to "America's Sweetheart" Shirley Temple put John Agar in the public eye for the first time, and a movie contract with independent producer David O. Selznick quickly ensued.John Agar debuted opposite John Wayne, Henry Fonda and "America's Sweetheart" Shirley Temple in John Ford's Il massacro di Fort Apache (1948), initial film in John Ford's's "Cavalry Trilogy".His marriage to "America's Sweetheart" Shirley Temple ended in 1949, while John Agar's movie career continued.Popular with fans of Westerns and sci-fi flicks, John Agar was a staple at film conventions and autograph shows.

Danny Aiello was born on June 20, 1933 in Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA as Daniel Louis Aiello Jr. Danny Aiello was an actor and producer, known for Fa' la cosa giusta (1989), Léon (1994) and Stregata dalla luna (1987). Danny Aiello was married to Sandy Cohen. Danny Aiello died on December 12, 2019 in New Jersey, USA.

The daughter of actress Geneviève Sorya, in 1948 she played the part of Juliette in Gli amanti di Verona (1949). During the 1950s and 1960s she made various films, including Montparnasse (1958) and La dolce vita (1960), but only Lola, donna di vita (1961) , Jacques Demy, and Un uomo, una donna (1966) Claude Lelouch saw major success. With Un uomo, una donna (1966) she had, but did not use, the chance to establish herself in America. Therefore she was only participating in second-row productions in Europe and America.

A graduate of the University of Minnesota, Eddie Albert was a circus trapeze flier before becoming a stage and radio actor. Eddie Albert made Eddie Albert's film debut in 1938 and has worked steadily since, often cast as the friendly, good-natured buddy of the hero but occasionally being cast as a villain; one of Eddie Albert's most memorable roles was as the cowardly, glory-seeking army officer in Robert Aldrich's World War 2 film, Prima linea (1956).

Robert Aldrich entered the film industry in 1941 when Robert Aldrich got a job as a production clerk at RKO Radio Pictures. Robert Aldrich soon worked Robert Aldrich's way up to script clerk, then became an assistant director, a production manager and an associate producer. Robert Aldrich began writing and directing for TV series in the early 1950s, and directed Robert Aldrich's first feature in 1953 (Il grande alleato (1953)). Soon thereafter Robert Aldrich established Robert Aldrich's own production company and produced most of Robert Aldrich's own films, collaborating in the writing of many of his own films. Among Robert Aldrich's best-known pictures are Un bacio e una pistola (1955), Che fine ha fatto Baby Jane? (1962) and the muscular WW II mega-hit Quella sporca dozzina (1967).

Muhammad Ali beat more champions and top contenders than any heavyweight champion in history. Muhammad Ali defeated heavyweight kings Sonny Liston (twice), Floyd Patterson (twice), Ernie Terrell, Jimmy Ellis, Ken Norton (twice), Joe Frazier (twice), George Foreman and Leon Spinks. Muhammad Ali defeated light-heavyweight champs Archie Moore and Bob Foster. Muhammad Ali defeated European heavyweight champions Henry Cooper, Karl Mildenberger, Jürgen Blin, Joe Bugner, Richard Dunn, Jean-Pierre Coopman and Alfredo Evangelista. Muhammad Ali defeated British and Commonwealth king Brian London. All of Muhammad Ali's defeats were by heavyweight champions: Joe Frazier (twice), Ken Norton (twice), Leon Spinks, Larry Holmes and Trevor Berbick. Muhammad Ali also beat undefeated fighters Sonny Banks (12-0), Billy Daniels (16-0), 'Rudi Lubbers' (21-0) and George Foreman (40-0).

A graduate of New York's Columbia School of Journalism, Irwin Allen was a magazine editor, the producer/director of a radio show and the owner of an advertising agency before entering film production in the 1950s. Irwin Allen's documentary, Il mare intorno di noi (1953), won an Academy Award. A successful TV series producer (Kronos (1966), Lost in Space (1965)), Irwin Allen was nicknamed "The Master of Disaster" in the 1970s due to the tremendous success of Irwin Allen's two special effects-laden epics, L'avventura del Poseidon (1972) and L'inferno di cristallo (1974).

One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers. One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers was born in Spain but moved to Cuba by age 18 to join One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers's exiled anti-Franco father. In Havana, One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers founded a cineclub and wrote film reviews. Then, One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers went on to study in Rome at the Centro Sperimentale. One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers directed six shorts in Cuba and two in New York. After the 1959 Cuban revolution, One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers returned and made several documentaries for the Castro-regime. But after two of One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers's shorts (Gente en la playa (1960) and La Tumba Francesca) had been banned, One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers moved to Paris. There One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers became the favourite cameraman of Éric Rohmer and François Truffaut. In 1978, One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers started One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers's impressive Hollywood-career. In One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers's later years, One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers co-directed two documentaries about the human rights situation in Cuba: Mauvaise conduite (1984) (about the persecution of gay people) and Nadie escuchaba (1987). One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers shot several prestigious commercials for Giorgio Armani and Calvin Klein. One of the highest appraised contemporary cinematographers died of cancer.

Maria Conchita Alonso was born Maria Concepcion Alonso Bustillo on June 29, 1957 in Cienfuegos, Cuba, but raised in Caracas, Venezuela. Maria Conchita Alonso was crowned Miss Teenager World in 1971 and later as Miss Distrito Federal became the first runner up in the Miss Venezuela 1975 competition placing later that year in the top seven of the Miss World 1975. Maria Conchita Alonso became a popular actress in Latin America, working in ten telenovelas (soap operas) and starred in a quartet of Venezuelan films. Maria Conchita Alonso was also a popular singer, and has three Grammy Award nominations.In 1982, Maria Conchita Alonso emigrated to the United States, and made Maria Conchita Alonso's Hollywood film debut in Paul Mazursky's Mosca a New York (1984), opposite Robin Williams. Maria Conchita Alonso also starred in movies such as Un tocco di velluto (1986), Ricercati: ufficialmente morti (1987), L'implacabile (1987), Colors - colori di guerra (1988), Stress da vampiro (1988), Predator 2 (1990) and La casa degli spiriti (1993). In 1995, Maria Conchita Alonso was playing Aurora/Spider Woman in a Broadway production of "Kiss of the Spider Woman", making Maria Conchita Alonso the first South American woman to star on the Great White Way.

The third of four children born to Anthony Alt and Muriel Alt, Carol Alt was raised in East Williston, NY. Carol Alt dropped out of school to move to Manhattan, where Carol Alt became one of the top models of the 1980s. Don Ameche was a versatile and popular American film actor in the 1930s and '40s, usually as the dapper, mustached leading man. Don Ameche's film career surged in a comeback in the 1980s with fine work as an aging millionaire in Una poltrona per due (1983) and a rejuvenated oldster in Cocoon - L'energia dell'universo (Don Ameche was born Dominic Felix Amici in Kenosha, Wisconsin, to Barbara Edda (Hertel) and Felice Amici, a bartender.

Born and raised in Sparks, Nevada, Mädchen Amick was encouraged by Mädchen Amick's parents to follow Mädchen Amick's own creative instincts where Mädchen Amick learned the skill of playing the piano, bass, violin and guitar as well as being able to do tap, ballet, jazz and modern dancing. In 1987 at the age of 16, Mädchen Amick traveled to Los Angeles to pursue a career in acting.

Born on January 5, 1962 in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, Susan Elizabeth "Suzy" Amis first worked as a Ford model before Amis began acting in the 1980s. Amis retired from acting after Amis's last appearance in the science fiction action film Catastrofe imminente (1999).In 2005, Amis founded Muse Elementary, a Reggio-inspired, independent, non-profit school in the Topanga, California area of Los Angeles.

Juliet was born in Burbank, California on July 23, 1938. (1968), Britannia Hospital (1982) and Io sono un campione (1963). Lindsay Anderson died on August 30, 1994 in Angoulême, Charente, France.

Bibi's artistic dreams came early in life and were further supported by Bibi's older sister Gerd Andersson who became a ballet dancer at the Royal Opera and made her older sister Gerd Andersson who became a ballet dancer at the Royal Opera and made her acting debut in 1951 acting debut in 1951. Theo Angelopoulos began to study law in Athens but broke up Theo Angelopoulos's studies to go to the Sorbonne in Paris in order to study literature. When Theo Angelopoulos had finished Theo Angelopoulos's studies, Theo Angelopoulos wanted to attend the School of Cinema at Paris but decided instead to go back to Greece. There Theo Angelopoulos worked as a journalist and critic for the newspaper "Demokratiki Allaghi" until the newspaper "Demokratiki Allaghi" was banned by the military after a coup d'état. Now unemployed, Theo Angelopoulos decided to make Theo Angelopoulos's first movie, Ricostruzione di un delitto (1970). Sensual, ambiguous, ultra sensitive French performer Jean-Hugues Anglade always had a reputation of intense and passionate actor. Any role, any language, Anglade seems to be able to do anything. Michelangelo Antonioni was born in 1912 into a middle-class family and grew up in bourgeois surroundings of the Italian province. In the Italian province Michelangelo Antonioni studied economics and commerce while Michelangelo Antonioni painted and also wrote criticism for a local newspaper. In 1939 Michelangelo Antonioni went to Rome and worked for the journal "Cinema" studying directorship at the School of Cinema. As Michelangelo Antonioni was indebted to neorealism Michelangelo Antonioni's films reflect Michelangelo Antonioni's bourgeois roots like in Michelangelo Antonioni's first movie Cronaca di un amore (1950) or La signora senza camelie (1953) or Le amiche (1955). Michelangelo Antonioni's biggest success was the trilogy L'avventura (1960), La notte (1961), and L'eclisse (1962), with which Michelangelo Antonioni won several prizes. This success allowed Michelangelo Antonioni to go abroad and to work on international scale in English: e.g. Blow-Up (1966) in London and Zabriskie Point (1970) in the USA as well as Professione: reporter (1975). A stroke in 1985 severely inhibited Michelangelo Antonioni's productivity until Michelangelo Antonioni's death in 2007.

Christina Applegate was born in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, to record producer/executive Robert Applegate and singer-actress Nancy Priddy.
