Ed Asner is a television legend, the winner of seven acting Emmy Awards (which puts Ed Asner tied with Mary Tyler Moore, both of whom rank second to their "Mary Tyler Moore Show (1970) Show" co-star, Cloris Leachman who has nine). Olivier Assayas is a French film director, screenwriter and film critic. Claudine Auger, a former Miss France 1st Runner-up (1958), received Claudine Auger, a former Miss France 1st Runner-up (1958)'s dramatic training at the Paris Drama Conservatory and is best known to US / UK audiences as the stunning brunette "Domino" opposite Sean Connery in the James Bond thriller Agente 007 - Thunderball: operazione tuono (1965), Claudine Auger, a former Miss France 1st Runner-up (1958) has kept fairly busy since Claudine Auger, a former Miss France 1st Runner-up (1958)'s Bond days, acting in a number of Italian, French and Spanish films including Il triangolo delle Bermude (1978), Credo (1983), and La bocca (1991).

Jim Backus was born Jim Backus on February 25, 1913 in Cleveland, Ohio. Jim Backus was one of the few actors to do it all: radio, Broadway, movies, television and cartoons. After attending preparatory school in Jim Backus's hometown Cleveland, Jim Backus enrolled at the American Academy of Dramatic Art, to ply Jim Backus's trade. While waiting for parts, Jim Backus did radio and became friends with such future notables as Garson Kanin and Keenan Wynn. Jim Backus stuck it out and soon was doing motion pictures in addition to radio. Jim Backus was typecast in roles as "rich types" but broke the mold when Jim Backus portrayed James Dean's father in the classic Gioventù bruciata (1955). With Jim Backus's career in full swing, Jim Backus also tackled two roles that Jim Backus would be best known for, Mr. Magoo in cartoons and Thurston Howell III in L'isola di Gilligan (1964). After L'isola di Gilligan run ended, Jim Backus continued doing guest spots on television and movies, before passing away on July 3, 1989.

Angelo Badalamenti was born on March 22, 1937 in New York City, New York, USA. Angelo Badalamenti is known for Angelo Badalamenti's work on Mulholland Drive (2001), Fuoco cammina con me (1992) and Strade perdute (1997).

English-born "Army brat" John Badham is the son of English actress Mary Hewitt and the stepson of an American Army general. Badham's breakthrough credit was the box office smash La febbre del sabato sera (1977), made the following year; other hits on Badham's's resume include Tuono blu (1983), Wargames - Giochi di guerra (1983), and Corto circuito (1986).

Maxine Bahns was born in 1971 in Vermont, the daughter of a German-American father and a Chinese-Brazilian mother. Maxine Bahns left home at 16 and traveled to Barcelona, Valencia, Paris and Rome. Returning to New York, Maxine Bahns attended NYU where Maxine Bahns majored in Latin and Greek language and literature, also attending acting classes at Three Arts Studios. During this time Maxine Bahns auditioned for Ed Burns' I fratelli McMullen (1995) and was cast as the female lead opposite Ed Burns'. Over the next few years, Maxine Bahns has appeared in various low budget independent films such as Il senso dell'amore (1996), Dangerous Curves (2000), Cutaway (2000), Vice (2000) and Spin Cycle (2000). On moving to Los Angeles, Maxine Bahns became involved in triathlons, and in 2001 Maxine Bahns competed in the Hawaii Ironman Championships. Maxine Bahns has also competed in numerous other triathlons such as the Wildflower 1/2 Ironman and the Keauhou 1/2 Ironman. Maxine Bahns has appeared on the covers of Runner's World, Triathlete Magazine, and Fit magazine.
Stuart Baird was born on January 14, 1947 in Uxbridge, Middlesex, England. Stuart Baird is known for Stuart Baird's work on Skyfall (2012), Superman (1978) and Casino Royale (2006).

Scott Stewart Bakula was born on October 9, 1954 in St. Louis, Missouri, to Sally (Zumwinkel) and J. Stewart Bakula, a lawyer. Scott Stewart Bakula is of German, as well as Czech, Austrian, Scottish and English ancestry. Scott Stewart Bakula comes from a musical family. In the fourth grade, Scott Stewart Bakula started a rock band and wrote songs for a rock band, Scott Stewart Bakula later sang with the St. Louis Symphony. Scott Stewart Bakula studied Law at the University of Kansas until Scott Stewart Bakula's sophomore year when Scott Stewart Bakula left to pursue acting. In 1976, Scott Stewart Bakula was first hired professionally in the role of Sam in "Shenandoah" and went to New York. After several small roles on television, Scott Stewart Bakula starred opposite Dean Stockwell in the science fiction series In viaggio nel tempo (1989). Scott Stewart Bakula played Dr. Sam Beckett, a physicist who was trapped by a malfunction of Dr. Sam Beckett, a physicist who was trapped by a malfunction of his time machine to correct things gone wrong in the past's time machine to correct things gone wrong in the past. Scott Stewart Bakula won a Golden Globe in 1992 for Best Performance by an Actor in a TV series - Drama for In viaggio nel tempo (1989) and was nominated for a Tony Award in 1988. Scott Stewart Bakula also starred in the prequel series Enterprise (2001) as Jonathan Archer, the captain of Earth's first long-range starship. Today, Scott Stewart Bakula lives in Los Angeles, California and has a farm in upstate New York.

Michael Ballhaus was a German cinematographer. Michael Ballhaus worked on many American films, including Baby It's You (1983), Old Enough (1984), After Hours (1985), The Color of Money (1986), The Last Temptation of Christ (1988), Goodfellas (1990), Dracula (1992), The Age of Innocence (1993), Gangs of New York (2002), and The Departed (Michael Ballhaus was nominated three times for the Academy Award for Best Cinematography, for Broadcast News (1987), The Fabulous Baker Boys (1989), and Gangs of New York (2002), but never won.Michael Ballhaus's son Florian Ballhaus is also a cinematographer who worked on Flightplan (2005) and The Devil Wears Prada (Michael Ballhaus died on 11 April 2017, at the age of 81.
Tamasaburô Bandô was born on April 25, 1950 in Tokyo, Japan. Tamasaburô Bandô is an actor and director, known for La donna dei sogni (1993), Gekashitsu (1992) and Tenshu monogatari (1995).

Scottish character actor and occasional leading man who enlivened scores of fine films in Britain and America. Bannen's father was a lawyer in a small town in Lanarkshire. Bannen served in the army and attended Ratcliffe College, Leicestershire. Bannen's first acting role came in a 1947 Dublin production of "Armlet of Jade". Bannen became a successful figure on the London stage, making a name for Bannen in the plays of both William Shakespeare and Eugene O'Neill. Bannen was an original member of the Royal Shakespeare Company and appeared on Broadway as well. Bannen's film debut occurred in the mid-1950s, and Bannen quickly rose to prominence, primarily in a wide range of supporting roles. Bannen's performance as "Crow" in Il volo della Fenice (1965) won Bannen an Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actor. Thirty years and scores of films later, Bannen was given the Lifetime Achievement Award of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts. Long after Bannen's leading man days had passed, Bannen won new acclaim for Bannen's role as the touchingly crafty villager in Svegliati Ned (1998). The following year Bannen died in an automobile accident. Bannen was survived by Bannen's wife of 23 years.

Olivia Barash has stepped behind the camera, creating content to direct for T.V. and film. Olivia Barash's on-set experience goes beyond what any film school could offer. This paved the way on Olivia Barash's latest journey, producing and directing film, T.V., music-videos and branded content. In 2016, Olivia Barash launched Olivia Barash's production company, Original Pixel Cowboys, to debut Olivia Barash's live action/animated Youtube series, BarkvilleTV. her live action/animated Youtube series, BarkvilleTV led Olivia Barash to create content and direct for The Pet Collective. OllyWoodDK is Olivia Barash's new production space, with partners, Norwood Fisher and David Kahne.
Clive Barker was born on October 5, 1952 in Liverpool, England. Clive Barker is a writer, known for Hellraiser (1987), Cabal (1990) and Candyman - Terrore dietro lo specchio (1992).

Jean-Marc Barr was born on September 27, 1960 in Bitburg, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany. Jean-Marc Barr is an actor and producer, known for Le grand bleu (1988), Lovers - French Dogma #1 (1999) and American Translation (2011).

Bruno Barreto was born on March 16, 1955 in Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil as Bruno Barreto. Bruno Barreto is a director and producer, known for Flores Raras (2013), 4 giorni a settembre (1997) and Donna Flor e i suoi due mariti (1976). Bruno Barreto was previously married to Amy Irving.

Majel Barrett was born on February 23, 1932 in Cleveland, Ohio, USA as Majel Leigh Hudec. Raymond J. Barry was born in New York, and attended Brown University, where Raymond J. Barry was a star athlete in football, basketball, and track. While there, Raymond J. Barry earned Raymond J. Barry's degree in Philosophy and as a senior, was cast in the stage production of "Picnic," where Raymond J. Barry played a football player. Raymond J. Famed actor, composer, artist, author and director. His talents extended to the authoring of the novel "Mr. Cartonwine: A Moral Tale" as well as his autobiography. Elmer Bernstein was educated at the Walden School and New York University. Elmer Bernstein served in the US Army Air Corps in World War II. Elmer Bernstein worked in various artistic endeavors, including painting and the theatre and also performed as an actor and dancer. Among Elmer Bernstein's early composition work were scores for United Nations radio programs and television and industrial documentaries. Elmer Bernstein's original scores for films range over an enormous variety of styles, with Elmer Bernstein's groundbreaking jazz score for L'uomo dal braccio d'oro (1955), light musical comedies such as Elmer Bernstein's Oscar-winning Millie (1967) score, and perhaps Elmer Bernstein's most familiar score, for the western I magnifici sette (1960).A few years before before Elmer Bernstein's death, Elmer Bernstein acquired something of a cult status among fans of English football when Elmer Bernstein's familiar main theme for La grande fuga (1963) was adopted by fans of English football and hummed and played, lustily, during matches.

Bibi Besch was born in Vienna, Austria, to race car driver Gotfrid Köchert and actress Gusti Huber. Adrian Biddle was born on July 20, 1952 in Woolwich, London, England. Adrian Biddle is known for Adrian Biddle's work on V per Vendetta (2005), Thelma & Louise (1991) and Aliens - Scontro finale (1986). Adrian Biddle was married to Mo. Adrian Biddle died on December 7, 2005 in London, England.

A very talented painter, Kathryn spent two years at the San Francisco Art Institute. At 20, Kathryn won a scholarship to the Whitney Museum's Independent Study Program. Robert Bresson trained as a painter before moving into films as a screenwriter, making a short film (atypically a comedy), Affaires publiques (1934) in 1934. From Journal d'un cure de campagne (1951) (aka "Diary of a Country Priest") onwards, Robert Bresson created a unique minimalist style in which all but the barest essentials are omitted from the film (often, crucial details are only given in the soundtrack), with the actors (Robert Bresson calls the actors "models") giving deliberately flat, expressionless performances. It's a demanding and difficult, intensely personal style, which means that Robert Bresson's films never achieved great popularity (it was rare for Robert Bresson to make more than one film every five years), but Robert Bresson has a fanatical following among critics, who rate Robert Bresson as one of the greatest artists in the history of the cinema. Roger Joseph Ebert was the all-time best-known, most successful movie critic in cinema history, when one thinks of Roger Joseph Ebert's establishing a rapport with both serious cineastes and the movie-going public and reaching more movie fans via television and print than any other critic. Roger Joseph Ebert became the first and only movie critic to win a Pulitzer Prize (it would be 28 years before another film critic, Stephen Hunter, would win journalism's top tchotchke). Roger Joseph Ebert's opinions likely were relied on by more movie-goers than any other critic in cinema history, making Roger Joseph Ebert the gold standard for film criticism.Roger Joseph Ebert was born in Urbana, Illinois, to Annabel (Stumm), a bookkeeper, and Walter Harry Ebert, an electrician. Roger Joseph Ebert was married to Chaz Ebert. Roger Joseph Ebert died on April 4, 2013, in Chicago, Illinois.

Aaron Eckhart was born on March 12, 1968 in Cupertino, California, USA as Aaron Edward Eckhart. Aaron Eckhart is an actor and producer, known for Il cavaliere oscuro (2008), Thank You for Smoking (2005) and Nella società degli uomini (1997).

Blake Edwards' stepfather's father J. Gordon Edwards was a silent screen director, and Blake Edwards''s stepfather Jack McEdward was a stage director and movie production manager. Blake Edwards' acted in a number films, beginning with I cavalieri azzurri (1942) and wrote a number of others, beginning with Pian della morte (1948) and including six for director Richard Quine. Blake Edwards' created the popular TV series Peter Gunn (1958), Mr. Lucky (1959) and Dante (1960). Chris Eigeman was born on March 1, 1965 in Denver, Colorado, USA as Christopher Eigeman. Chris Eigeman is an actor and director, known for Metropolitan (1990), Turn the River (2007) and Barcelona (1994). Chris Eigeman has been married to Linda D. Eigeman since 1993. They have one child.

The son of an affluent architect, Eisenstein attended the Institute of Civil Engineering in Petrograd as a young man. With the fall of the tsar in 1917, Eisenstein worked as an engineer for the Red Army. In the following years, Eisenstein joined up with the Moscow Proletkult Theater as a set designer and then director. the Moscow Proletkult Theater's director, Vsevolod Meyerhold, became a big influence on Eisenstein, introducing Eisenstein to the concept of biomechanics, or conditioned spontaneity. Eisenstein furthered The Proletkult's director, Vsevolod Meyerhold,'s theory with Eisenstein's own "montage of attractions"--a sequence of pictures whose total emotion effect is greater than the sum of its parts. Eisenstein later theorized that this style of editing worked in a similar fashion to Marx's dialectic. Though Eisenstein wanted to make films for the common man, Eisenstein's intense use of symbolism and metaphor in what Eisenstein called "intellectual montage" sometimes lost Eisenstein's audience. Though Eisenstein made only seven films in Eisenstein's career, Eisenstein and Eisenstein's theoretical writings demonstrated how film could move beyond film's nineteenth-century predecessor--Victorian theatre-- to create abstract concepts with concrete images.

Colorful American character actor equally adept at vicious killers or grizzled sidekicks. As a child Elam worked in the cotton fields. Elam attended Santa Monica Junior College in California and subsequently became an accountant and, at one time, manager of the Bel Air Hotel. Elam got Elam's first movie job by trading Elam's accounting services for a role. In short time Elam became one of the most memorable supporting players in Hollywood, thanks not only to Elam's near-demented screen persona but also to an out-of-kilter left eye, sightless from a childhood fight. Elam appeared with great aplomb in Westerns and gangster films alike, and in later years played to wonderful effect in comedic roles.

Carmen Electra was born Tara Leigh Patrick on April 20, 1972 in Sharonville, Ohio, to Patricia Rose (Kincade), a singer, and Harry Stanley Patrick, an entertainer and guitarist. Carmen Electra later returned to work for Prince at Prince's Los Angeles, California nightclub "Glam Slam". Carmen Electra performed there every weekend with the Erotic City dancers, led by choreographer and director Jamie King. In March 1997, Carmen Electra appeared in cartoon form as the model for a character who is a singer and a vampire ("but a good vampire", says Carmen Electra's publicist) in a comic book series called "Embrace". Carmen Electra later went to co-star on the television series Baywatch (1989) as lifeguard Lani McKenzie, and as host of MTV's game show Singled Out (1995).

Much-loved character actor who specialised in playing slightly sleazy/slightly eccentric and often flawed upper middle class English gentlemen. His career spanned nearly 40 years, becoming a well-known face both in Britain and in the States.

Noah Emmerich was born and raised in New York City, to Constance, a concert pianist, and André Emmerich, an art dealer and gallery owner. Gabriel Yared stopped Gabriel Yared's law studies at the age of 20 to work as a professional music composer. Gabriel Yared studied with Henri Dutilleux and Maurice Ohana. Gabriel Yared worked as a composer, orchestrator or producer for such singers as Françoise Hardy, Charles Aznavour, Gilbert Bécaud and Mireille Mathieu. Born into a wealthy and influential English family, Ian Fleming spent Ian Fleming's early years attending top British schools such as Eton and Sandhurst military academy. Ian Fleming took to writing while schooling in Kitzbuhel, Austria, and upon failing the entrance requirements for Foreign Service joined the news agency Reuters as a journalist -- winning the respect of Ian Fleming's peers for Ian Fleming's coverage of a "show trial" in Russia of several Royal Engineers on espionage charges. Ian Fleming briefly worked in the financial sector for the family bank, but just prior to the Second World War, was recruited into British Naval Intelligence where Ian Fleming excelled, shortly achieving the rank of Commander. When the Second World War ended, Ian Fleming retired to Jamaica where Ian Fleming built a house called "Goldeneye," took up writing full-time and created the character that would make Ian Fleming famous -- British Secret Service agent James Bond, in a novel called "Casino Royale." Ian Fleming spent the rest of Ian Fleming's life writing and traveling the world, but as Ian Fleming's Bond character reached new heights of popularity on movie screens, Ian Fleming was in ailing health. Ian Fleming died of a heart attack (Ian Fleming's second) in England in August 1964 at the age of 56.

Milos Forman was born Jan Tomas Forman in Caslav, Czechoslovakia, to Anna (Svabova), who ran a summer hotel, and Rudolf Forman, a professor. During World War II, Milos Forman's parents were taken away by the Nazis, after being accused of participating in the underground resistance. Milos Forman's father died in Buchenwald and Milos Forman's mother died in Auschwitz, and Milos Forman became an orphan very early on. Milos Forman studied screen-writing at the Prague Film Academy (F.A.M.U.). In Milos Forman's Czechoslovakian films, L'asso di picche (1964), Gli amori di una bionda (1965), and Al fuoco pompieri! (1967), Milos Forman created Milos Forman's own style of comedy. During the invasion of Milos Forman's country by the troops of the Warsaw pact in the summer of 1968 to stop the Prague spring, Milos Forman left Europe for the United States. In spite of difficulties, Milos Forman filmed Taking Off (1971) there and achieved Milos Forman's fame later with Qualcuno volò sul nido del cuculo (1975) adapted from the novel of Ken Kesey, which won five Oscars including one for direction. Other important films of Milos Forman were the musical Hair (1979) and Milos Forman's biography of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Amadeus (1984), which won eight Oscars.

John Forysthe was born Jacob Lincoln Freund in Penns Grove, New Jersey, the son of Blanche Materson (Blohm) and Samuel Jeremiah Freund, a Wall Street businessman. Friedkin's mother was an operating room nurse. Friedkin's's father was a merchant seaman, semi-pro softball player and ultimately sold clothes in a men's discount chain. Mason began Mason's film-acting career at age six when director Harold Ramis cast Mason in Ricomincio da capo (1993). James Gandolfini was born in Westwood, New Jersey, to Santa (Penna), a high school lunchlady, and James Joseph Gandolfini, Sr., a bricklayer and head school janitor. Victor Garber has been in some of the most memorable projects of the past four decades. Victor Garber has recently appeared in The Slap (2015), The Flash (2014), Motive (2013) and Web Therapy (2011). Comedian, actor, composer and conductor, educated in New York public schools. He was a master of ceremonies in amateur shows, a carnival barker, daredevil driver and a disc jockey., and later a comedian in night clubs. By the mid-1950s he had turned to writing original music and recording a series of popular and best-selling albums with his orchestra for Capitol Records. Joining ASCAP in 1953, his instrumental compositions include "Melancholy Serenade", "Glamour", "Lover's Rhapsody", "On the Beach" and "To a Sleeping Beauty", among numerous others.

Tony Award-winning English actor Michael Gough, best known for playing the butler Alfred Pennyworth in the first four Batman (1989, 1992, 1995 & 1997) movies and for playing the arch-criminal Dr. Clement Armstrong in Agente speciale (1961) episode "The Cybernauts", was an accomplished performer on both stage and screen. Graham Greene was born on June 22, 1952 in Six Nations Reserve, Ontario, Canada. Graham Greene is known for Graham Greene's work on Il miglio verde (1999), I segreti di Wind River (2017) and Balla coi lupi (1990). Graham Greene has been married to Hilary Blackmore since December 20, 1990.

Lorne Greene was born Lorne Greene on February 12, 1915, in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Lorne Greene began acting while attending Canada's Queen's University, and after graduation got a job in radio broadcasting. Lorne Greene's rich, deep, authoritarian voice quickly propelled Lorne Greene to prominence as Canada's top newscaster. Lorne Greene left Canada in the early 1950s for a film career in Hollywood, and soon began appearing regularly in television, films and on radio. Lorne Greene's greatest successes came in two television series, the long-running Western Bonanza (1959), in which Lorne Greene played the patriarch of a wealthy frontier family, and the science-fiction series Battaglie nella galassia (1978). In 1969 Lorne Greene was awarded Officer of the Order of Canada for Lorne Greene's services to the performing arts and community.Lorne Greene died at age 72 of pneumonia following heart surgery on September 11, 1987, in Santa Monica, CA.

Richard Grieco was born to an Italian father (Richard Grieco) and an Irish mother (Carolyn O'Reilly). Richard Grieco calls Richard Grieco's work "Abstract Emotionalism". Currently, Richard Grieco is single and lives in Los Angeles.

Thomas Ian Griffith was born on March 18, 1962 in Hartford, Connecticut. Referred to by some as a dadaistic comedian, Andy Kaufman took comedy and performance art to the edges of irrationality and blurred the dividing line between reality and imagination. Born in New York City on January 17, 1949, the first son of Stanley and Janice Kaufman, Andy Kaufman grew up on New York City in the town of Great Neck. Andy Kaufman began performing for family and friends at the age of 7, and by the time Andy Kaufman was 9 was being hired to entertain at children's parties. After a year at a Boston junior college, Andy Kaufman began performing Andy Kaufman's unique brand of stand-up comedy at coffee shops and nightclubs on the east coast. Discovered by Improvisation comedy club owner Bud Friedman, Andy Kaufman quickly earned a reputation as a talented, yet eccentric performer. Impressed by Andy Kaufman's abilities, Lorne Michaels asked Andy Kaufman to appear on the inaugural broadcast of Saturday Night Live (October 11, 1975). Best known for Andy Kaufman's work as Latka Gravas on the TV sitcom Taxi, Andy Kaufman appeared in several TV shows and movies, on Broadway, did a one man show at Carnegie Hall, enjoyed a brief professional wrestling career and performed in concerts nation-wide.

Julie Kavner was born on September 7, 1950 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Julie Kavner. Julie Kavner is an actress, known for I Simpson (1989), I Simpson - Il film (2007) and Cambia la tua vita con un click (2006).

Son of character actor Robert Keith and stage actress Helena Shipman. He grew up on the road with his parents while character actor Robert Keith and stage actress Helena Shipman toured in plays. First appeared at age 3 in film Pied Piper Malone (1924) with his father. Began acting in radio programs and on stage before World War II. Joined the Marines and served as a machine gunner. Returned to Broadway stage after World War II and branched out into television and film. Worked as an extra in several films before achieving speaking roles and subsequent stardom.

Krzysztof Kieslowski graduated from Lódz Film School in 1969, and became a documentary, TV and feature film director and scriptwriter. Krzysztof Kieslowski's next TV title, Personel (1975) (The Staff), took the Grand Prix at Mannheim Film Festival. Krzysztof Kieslowski's first full-length feature was Blizna (1976) (The Scar). In 1978 Krzysztof Kieslowski made the famous documentary Z punktu widzenia nocnego portiera (1979) (Night Porter's Point of View), and in 1979 - a feature Il cineamatore (1979) (Camera Buff), which was acclaimed in Poland and abroad. Everything Krzysztof Kieslowski did from that point was of highest artistic quality.

Takeshi Kitano originally studied to become an engineer, but was thrown out of school for rebellious behavior. Takeshi Kitano learned comedy, singing and dancing from famed comedian Senzaburô Fukami. Working as a lift boy on a nightclub with such features as comic sketches and striptease dancing, Takeshi Kitano saw Takeshi Kitano's chance when a comedian suddenly fell ill, and Takeshi Kitano went on stage in a comedian's place. With a friend Takeshi Kitano formed the comic duo "The Two Beat" (Takeshi Kitano's artist's name, "Beat Takeshi", comes from this period), which became very popular on Japanese television.Takeshi Kitano soon embarked on an acting career, and when the director of Violent Cop (1989) (aka "Violent Cop") fell ill, Takeshi Kitano took over that function as well. Immediately after Violent Cop (1989) (aka "Violent Cop") was finished Takeshi Kitano set out to make a second gangster movie, Boiling Point (1990). Just after finishing Getting Any? (1994), Takeshi Kitano was involved in a serious motorcycle accident that almost killed Takeshi Kitano. a serious motorcycle accident that almost killed him changed Takeshi Kitano's way of life, and Takeshi Kitano This change an active painter. This change can be seen in Takeshi Kitano's later films, which are characterized by Takeshi Kitano's giving more importance to the aesthetics of the film, such as in Hana-bi - Fiori di fuoco (1997) and L'estate di Kikujiro (1999).

As a film character actor, Klugman was the epitome of the everyman. Klugman was one of the pioneers of television acting in the 1950s, and is best remembered for Klugman's 1970s TV work as Oscar Madison on La strana coppia (1970) and as the medical examiner on Quincy (1976).

Charles R. Korsmo is an Assistant Professor of Law and the U.S. director of the Canada-U.S. Law Institute at the Case Western Reserve University School of Law, where Charles R. Korsmo teaches courses in corporate law, corporate finance, and torts. Charles R. Korsmo's articles have appeared in the William & Mary Law Review and Brooklyn Law Review, among others. Charles R. Jerry Orbach was born in the Bronx, New York, the only child of Leon Orbach, a former vaudevillian actor, was a German Jewish immigrant, who was born in Hamburg, Germany, and Emily (nee Olexy), a radio singer, was born in Pennsylvania to immigrant Polish-Lithuanian Roman Catholic parents, Alexander Olexy and Susanna (nee Klauba). Anna Paquin is the first millennial to have received an Academy Award nomination for acting, and the first to win.Anna Paquin was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada, in 1982, to Mary (Brophy), an English teacher from Wellington, New Zealand, and Brian Paquin, a Canadian phys-ed teacher. Michael Kevin Paré was born on October 9, 1958 in Brooklyn, New York City, to Joan (Moroney) and Francis Paré, who owned print shops. One of modern TV and moviedom's most sturdy and reliable character actors, David Paymer dreamed of his acting dream an actor from early childhood. Christopher D'Olier Reeve was born September 25, 1952, in New York City, to journalist Barbara Johnson (née Barbara Pitney Lamb) and writer/professor F.D. Reeve (Franklin D'Olier Reeve). In Christopher D'Olier Reeve's final year at Cornell University, Christopher D'Olier Reeve was one of two students selected (Robin Williams was the other) to study at New York City's famous Juilliard School, under the renowned John Houseman. Although Christopher D'Olier Reeve is best known for Christopher D'Olier Reeve's role as Superman (1978), a role which Christopher D'Olier Reeve played with both charisma and grace, Christopher D'Olier Reeve's acting career spans a much larger ground. Judge Reinhold has been in over seventy-five motion picture and television roles and enjoys a 25-year relationship with an international audience of all ages. Lee Remick was born in Quincy, Massachusetts, to Gertrude Margaret (Waldo), an actress, and Francis Edwin Remick, a department store owner. Lee Remick had Irish and English ancestry. Joan Rivers was born on June 8, 1933 in Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA as Joan Alexandra Molinsky. Christopher Julius Rock was born in Andrews, South Carolina and raised in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, New York. Roy Rogers (born Leonard Slye) moved to California in 1930, aged 18. In 1934 Roy Rogers formed a group with Bob Nolan called Sons of the Pioneers. While in a group with Bob Nolan called Sons of the Pioneers Roy Rogers was known as Leonard Slye, then Dick Weston. a group with Bob Nolan called Sons of the Pioneers's songs included "Cool Water" and "Tumbling Tumbleweeds". a group with Bob Nolan called Sons of the Pioneers first appeared in the western Rhythm on the Range (1936), starring Bing Crosby and Martha Raye. In 1936 Roy Rogers appeared as a bandit opposite Gene Autry in "The Old Coral". In 1937 Roy Rogers went solo from "a group with Bob Nolan called Sons of the Pioneers", and made Roy Rogers's first starring film in 1938, Under Western Stars (1938). Roy Rogers made almost 100 films. The Roy Rogers Show (1951) ran on NBC from October 1951 through 1957 and on CBS from 1961 to September 1964. In 1955, 67 of Roy Rogers's feature films were released to television.

Mark knew Mark wanted to be an actor at age nine; Mark took Mark's career and studies to Europe to fulfill Mark's dream. Alan Ruck was born on July 1, 1956 in Cleveland, Ohio, and has made over 100 appearances in films and television, and on stage. Ruehl received Ruehl's first Academy Award nomination and win for Ruehl's performance as Anne Napolitano, the emotionally driven girlfriend to fallen radio personality, (played by Jeff Bridges), in Terry Gilliam's masterpiece, La leggenda del re pescatore (1991). In addition to an Oscar, and a Golden Globe, Ruehl's performance garnered several accolades. Los Angeles Times commended her performance as Anne Napolitano, the emotionally driven girlfriend to fallen radio personality, (played by Jeff Bridges), calling her performance as Anne Napolitano, the emotionally driven girlfriend to fallen radio personality, (played by Jeff Bridges) "a bravura performance that runs from high, bantering comedy to an intense projection of pain and sorrow."Notable film credits include La leggenda del re pescatore (1991), Proibito amare (1993) and Roseanna's Grave (1997).

Jennifer Runyon was born on April 1, 1960 in Chicago, Illinois, USA. Ken Russell tried several professions before choosing to become a film director; Ken Russell was a still photographer and a dancer and Ken Russell even served in the Army, but film was Ken Russell's destiny. Ken Russell began by making several short films which paved the way for Ken Russell's brilliant television films of the 1960s that are acclaimed for Ken Russell's attention to detail and opulent visuals. Ken Russell's third feature film Donne in amore (1969) was a triumph that made Ken Russell known internationally. In the 1970s, Ken Russell's talent truly blossomed. Over the next two decades Ken Russell would direct a succession of remarkable films, most containing the trademark flamboyance that critics generally dismiss but many find engrossing. Ken Russell will forever be remembered as a controversial, visionary artist with something of a third eye for oddball dramas with captivating images and themes.

George Sanders was born of English parents in St. Petersburg, Russia. George Sanders worked in a Birmingham textile mill, in the tobacco business and as a writer in advertising. George Sanders entered show business in London as a chorus boy, going from there to cabaret, radio and theatrical understudy. George Sanders's film debut, in the same year, was as Curly Randall in Find the Lady (1936). George Sanders's U.S. debut, the same year, with Twentieth Century-Fox, was as Lord Everett Stacy in I lloyds di Londra (the same year). During the late 1930s and early 1940s George Sanders made a number of movies as Simon Templar--the Saint--and as Gay Lawrence, the Falcon. George Sanders played Nazis (Maj. Quive-Smith in Fritz Lang's Duello mortale (1941)), royalty (Charles II in Otto Preminger's Ambra (1947)), and biblical roles (Saran of Gaza in Cecil B. DeMille's Sansone e Dalila (1949)). George Sanders won the 1950 Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor as theatre critic Addison De Witt in Joseph L. Mankiewicz's Eva contro Eva (1950). In 1957 George Sanders hosted a TV series, The George Sanders Mystery Theater (1957). George Sanders continued to play mostly villains and charming heels until George Sanders's suicide in 1972.

Of Greek descent on both sides, the son of immigrants, Savalas was a soldier during World War II, although most of Savalas's enlistment records were destroyed in a fire at the National Personnel Records Center in St. Louis, Missouri, in 1973. Savalas later studied psychology at Columbia University under the GI Bill.Iconically bald, Savalas often played character roles, sometimes as sadists or psychotics. Savalas became famous in the 1970s when Savalas's role as Det. Theo Kojak in the TV movie Il caso Nelson è suo (1973) was expanded into the gritty Il tenente Kojak (1973) TV series (1973-78).

Devon started Devon's career as a young actor in Vancouver, Canada. First in the theater, and then moving onto smaller roles on TV. Vincent Schiavelli, selected in 1997 by Vanity Fair as one of the best character actors in America, had made over 120 film and television appearances. Born in New York and raised in Los Angeles, Schwimmer was encouraged by a high school instructor to attend a summer program in acting at Northwestern University. Kyle is the youngest of three sons. Kyle's father was a salesman for Beechnut. Kyra Minturn Sedgwick was born on August 19, 1965 in New York City, to Patricia (Rosenwald), a family and speech therapist, and Henry Dwight Sedgwick V, a venture capitalist. Rufus Sewell was born on the 29th of October 1967 in Twickenham, England. Rufus Sewell's mother, Jo, was Welsh, and was an artist and painter. Rufus Sewell attended London's Central School of Speech and Drama and left in June of 1989 after completing three years of training. Nick Stahl was born in Harlingen, Texas on December 5, 1979, to Donna Lynn, a brokerage assistant, and William Kent Stahl, a businessman. Photogenic American child actor of the 1940s, popular due in no small measure to his air of innocence and his beautiful, cherubic face with his beautiful, cherubic face with its dimples and his sparkling eyes, topped with a crown of curls's dimples and his sparkling eyes, topped with a crown of curls. Peter Stormare was born in Arbrå, Gävleborgs län, Sweden, to Gunhild (Holm) and Karl Ingvar Storm. John Toll is an American cinematographer. John Toll's filmography spans a wide variety of genres, including epic period drama, comedy, science fiction, and contemporary drama. John Toll won the Academy Award for Best Cinematography in both 1994 and 1995 for Legends of the Fall and Braveheart respectively.John Toll has collaborated with several noteworthy directors, including Francis Ford Coppola, Edward Zwick, Terrence Malick, Mel Gibson, John Madden, The Wachowskis, and Ang Lee. Outside of film, John Toll has shot several commercials, the pilot episode of Golden Globe-winning drama series Breaking Bad, and has served as chief cinematographer on the Netflix original series Sense8.Toll was also nominated for an Academy Award for John Toll's work on The Thin Red Line (1998).

Writer, director, producer, actor. Born in Los Angeles, California, USA, and raised in the seaport town of San Pedro. Got his start acting and writing for legendary exploitation director/producer Roger Corman. Came into his own during the 1970s when he was regarded as one of the finest screenwriters in Hollywood. Began directing with mixed success in 1982. One of the best script doctors in Hollywood, he contributed crucial scenes to such films as Gangster Story (1967) and Il padrino (1972).

Nancy Travis was born in New York City, to Theresa, a social worker, and Gordon Travis, a sales executive. Nancy Travis lived in Baltimore and Boston before returning to Nancy Travis's birthplace to study drama at New York University. Nancy Travis's first job out of school was with New York City's American Jewish Theater, after which Nancy Travis hit the road, joining the national tour of Neil Simon's "Brighton Beach Memoirs." Nancy Travis has maintained a connection to the stage throughout Nancy Travis's career. A founding member of the New York City off-Broadway theater company Naked Angels, Nancy Travis appeared in the New York-based off-Broadway theater company Naked Angels's production of Frank Pugliese's play "Aven-U Boys, " as well as "King of Connecticut" with Frances McDormand. Nancy Travis also performed in the Broadway run of the award-winning play "I'm Not Rappaport" with Cleavon Little and Judd Hirsch. More recently, Nancy Travis appeared in Athol Fugard's "My Children, My Africa," which Athol Fugard's directed at the La Jolla Playhouse. No stranger to television, Nancy Travis starred with Peter Gallagher and Isabella Rossellini in the Tom Cruise-directed segment of the Showtime anthology series Fallen Angels (1993).

Danny Trejo was born Dan Trejo in Echo Park, Los Angeles, to Alice (Rivera) and Dan Trejo, a construction worker. A child drug addict and criminal, Danny Trejo was in and out of jail for 11 years. While serving time in San Quentin, Danny Trejo won the lightweight and welterweight boxing titles. Imprisoned for armed robbery and drug offenses, Danny Trejo successfully completed a 12-step rehabilitation program that changed Danny Trejo's life. While speaking at a Cocaine Anonymous meeting in 1985, Danny Trejo met a young man who later called Danny Trejo for support. Danny Trejo went to meet a young man who later called him for support at what turned out to be the set of A 30 secondi dalla fine (1985). Danny Trejo was immediately offered a role as a convict extra, probably because of Danny Trejo's tough tattooed appearance. Also on the set of A 30 secondi dalla fine (1985) was a screenwriter who did time with Danny Trejo in San Quentin. Remembering Danny Trejo's boxing skills, a screenwriter who did time with Trejo in San Quentin offered Danny Trejo $320 per day to train the actors for a boxing match. Director Andrey Konchalovskiy saw Danny Trejo training Eric Roberts and immediately offered Danny Trejo a featured role as Eric Roberts's opponent in A 30 secondi dalla fine (1985). Danny Trejo has subsequently appeared in many other films, usually as a tough criminal or villain.Danny Trejo is of Mexican descent.

Cicely Tyson was born in Harlem, New York City, where Cicely Tyson was raised by Cicely Tyson devoutly religious parents, from the Caribbean island of Nevis. Cicely Tyson's mother, Theodosia, was a domestic, and Cicely Tyson's father, William Tyson, was a carpenter and painter. Cicely Tyson was discovered by a fashion editor at Ebony magazine and, with Cicely Tyson's stunning looks, Cicely Tyson quickly rose to the top of the modeling industry. In 1957, Cicely Tyson began acting in Off-Broadway productions. Cicely Tyson had small roles in feature films before Cicely Tyson was cast as Portia in L'urlo del silenzio (1968). Four years later, Cicely Tyson was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actress for Cicely Tyson's sensational performance in the critically acclaimed film Sounder (1972). In 1974, Cicely Tyson went on to portray a 110-year-old former slave in Autobiografia di Miss Jane Pittman (1974), which earned Cicely Tyson two Emmy Awards. Cicely Tyson also appeared in the television miniseries Radici (1977), King (1978) and A Woman Called Moses (1978). While Cicely Tyson has not appeared steadily onscreen because of Cicely Tyson's loyalty to only portray strong, positive images of Black women, Cicely Tyson is without a doubt one of the most talented, beautiful actresses to have ever graced the stage and screen.

Robert grew up in Toronto, Ohio, where Robert's athletic ability led to a four year football scholarship at Florida State University (FSU). There Robert earned a B.A. in Communications. Robert later received an M.A. at Michigan State University and then joined WGN radio in Chicago as a sales account representative. Robert then briefly appeared as a TV weatherman, and soon realized that Robert wanted to become an actor.Robert's big break came in 1972 when Robert played Burt Reynolds's younger brother in a stage production of "The Rainmaker". Burt Reynolds's and Robert were both alumni of Florida State University (FSU). Burt Reynolds's brought Robert to California and let Robert stay in Burt Reynolds's's home until Robert got Robert's acting break. Burt Reynolds's recommended Robert to producer Aaron Spelling for the TV series S.W.A.T. - Squadra Speciale Anticrimine (that series. Although that series lasted only one season, producer Aaron Spelling remembered Robert and later cast Robert in Vega$ (1978), which had a longer run.Robert was starring in the TV series The Lazarus Man (1996) when Robert was diagnosed with cancer, which caused the cancellation of The Lazarus Man. cancer went into remission after treatment and Robert resumed acting again with Robert's role as Captain Jim Kennedy III on Love Boat: The Next Wave (1998).

Gus Van Sant was born on July 24, 1952 in Louisville, Kentucky, USA as Gus Greene Van Sant Junior. Gus Van Sant is a director and producer, known for Elephant (2003), Belli e dannati (1991) and Drugstore Cowboy (1989).

James Albert Varney, Jr. was born in Lexington, Kentucky, to Nancy Louise (Howard) and James Albert Varney, Sr. James Albert Varney, Jr. became interested in theater as a teenager, winning state titles in drama competitions while a student at Lafayette High School in Lexington, Kentucky. At age 15 James Albert Varney, Jr. played Ebeneezer Scrooge in a local children's theater production of "A Christmas Carol", and by 17 was performing professionally in nightclubs and coffee houses. James Albert Varney, Jr. chose Nashville rather than New York or Los Angeles as a place to pursue James Albert Varney, Jr.'s acting career and, with advertising executive John R. Cherry III, turned "Ernest P. Worrell" into a cash cow, making commercials for clients ranging from soft drinks to food stores and, eventually, Disney. Even though "Ernest P. Worrell"'s catchphrase "KnowhutImean?" became a national craze almost immediately, James Albert Varney, Jr. worked in TV and film for more than a decade before James Albert Varney, Jr.'s famous alter-ego hit the big screen in Ernesto guai in campeggio (1987).

Reginald VelJohnson was born on August 16, 1952 in Queens, New York, USA. Reginald VelJohnson is an actor and writer, known for Trappola di cristallo (1988), 58 minuti per morire - Die Harder (1990) and Ghostbusters (Acchiappafantasmi) (1984).

Jesse Ventura was born in Minneapolis, Minnesota, to Bernice Martha (Lenz), a nurse who was of German descent, and George William Janos, a steam fitter of Slovak ancestry. In November 1990, Jesse Ventura was elected to a four-year term as mayor of Brooklyn Park, Minnesota, a suburb of Minneapolis, Minnesota with a population of around 56,000. After Jesse Ventura's mayoral term, Jesse Ventura purchased a small hobby farm in nearby Maple Grove, Minnesota and moved from Brooklyn Park, Minnesota, a suburb of Minneapolis with a population of around 56,000. In November 1998, Jesse Ventura, as a member of the Reform Party, was elected Governor of Minnesota. Jesse Ventura served as governor from 1999 to 2003 and did not run for a second term.

Andrew Kevin Walker was born on August 14, 1964 in Altoona, Pennsylvania, USA. Andrew Kevin Walker is a writer and actor, known for Seven (1995), Il mistero di Sleepy Hollow (1999) and 8mm - Delitto a luci rosse (1999).

Ray Walston started Ray Walston's acting career as a spear carrier with a local stock company. Ray Walston went on to associate with Margo Jones at the Houston Civic Theater for six years, then spent three seasons with the Cleveland Playhouse before arriving in New York in 1945. Ray Walston has won a Tony Award for Ray Walston's performance as the Devil in Broadway's "Damn Yankees", two Emmy Awards for La famiglia Brock (1992), and become a household name playing the extraterrestrial "Uncle Martin" on My Favorite Martian (1963). Ray Walston died at age 86 of lupus on New Year's Day 2001 in Beverly Hills, California.

George Robert Wendt III was born and raised in Chicago, Illinois, USA, to Loretta Mary (Howard) and George Robert Wendt, who was a realtor and navy officer. George Robert Wendt III attended a strict Jesuit prep school and then dropped out of Notre Dame University after a few uneventful years. George Robert Wendt III worked with the Windy City's famed Second City comedy troupe from 1974-1980. Probably the most ambitious and visually distinctive filmmaker to emerge from Denmark since Carl Theodor Dreyer over 60 years earlier, Lars von Trier studied film at the Danish Film School and attracted international attention with Lars von Trier's very first feature, L'elemento del crimine (1984). Lars von Trier's subsequent features Epidemic (1987) and Europa (1991) have been equally ambitious both thematically and visually, though Lars von Trier's international fame is most likely to be based on Il regno (1994), a TV soap opera blending hospital drama, ghost story and I segreti di Twin Peaks (1990)-style surrealism that was so successful in Denmark that it was released internationally as a 280-minute theatrical feature.

Soon he would be teamed with other "exotics" (e.g. Maria Montez and Sabu) in a series of escapist adventures, filmed in glorious Technicolor and set in lands of fable, which proved most popular with movie audiences of the World War II years. Andrew Birkin was born on December 9, 1945 in London, England as Andrew Birkin. Andrew Birkin is known for Andrew Birkin's work on Il nome della rosa (1986), Il giardino di cemento (1993) and Profumo - Storia di un assassino (2006).

Rubén Blades was born on July 16, 1948 in Panama City, Panama as Rubén Blades. Rubén Blades is an actor, known for C'era una volta in Messico (2003), Safe House - Nessuno è al sicuro (2012) and The Counselor - Il procuratore (2013). Rubén Blades has been married to Luba Mason since 2006. Rubén Blades was previously married to Lisa Lebenzon.

Moritz Bleibtreu is a German actor born on August 13, 1971 in Munich growing up in Hamburg. Moritz Bleibtreu first appears in children's television series Neues aus Uhlenbusch (1977) at the age of six. Moritz Bleibtreu's breakthrough was the role called "Abdul" in the movie Knockin' on Heaven's Door (1997). Moritz Bleibtreu also became internationally known for Moritz Bleibtreu's work on Lola corre (1998), The Experiment (2001) and World War Z (2013). In Germany, Moritz Bleibtreu is well known for the classic stoner-movie called Lammbock (2001) in which Moritz Bleibtreu plays the leading role. Moritz Bleibtreu speaks fluent German, English, French and Italian and is the son of Austrian actors Hans Brenner and Monica Bleibtreu.

Corinne Bohrer was born on October 18, 1958 in Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, USA. Corinne Bohrer is an actress, known for Scuola di polizia 4: Cittadini in... guardia (1987), Flash (1990) and Big Eden (2000).

Romane Bohringer was born on August 14, 1973 in Pont-Sainte-Maxence, Oise, France. Romane Bohringer is an actress and director, known for L'amour flou - Come separarsi e restare amici (2018), Notti selvagge (1992) and L'appartamento (1996).

Lizzie Borden was born on February 3, 1958 in Detroit, Michigan, USA as Lizzie Borden. Lizzie Borden is a director and writer, known for Nate tra le fiamme (1983), Le professioniste del peccato (1986) and Sola con l'assassino (1992).

Born and raised in San Antonio, Texas, Borrego studied theatre and dance at The University of Incarnate Word; Borrego studied acting at The California Institute of the Arts. In the 1980s Borrego attended an open audition for the TV Series "Fame" where Borrego won the role of "Jesse Velasquez", a role Borrego would have for three years. Borrego, however, would return to the stage appearing in productions at the noted Joseph Papp Theatre in New York City and The Mark Taper Forum in Los Angeles. In addition to standout performances on stage and in films such as "Blood In, Blood Out" and "Follow Me Home", Borrego began Lupita Productions in 1990. Lupita Productions has produced theatrical productions and concerts; additionally, Lupita Productions has produced two 16mm short films: "El Suendo de Simon" (1993) by Borrego and "Flattime" (1995) by Jimmy Santiago Baca. At home in front of the camera, on stage, or in the producer's seat, Borrego continues to be one of the most versatile and resilient talents of our time.

Élodie Bouchez was born on April 5, 1973 in Montreuil, Seine-Saint-Denis, France. Élodie Bouchez is an actress, known for L'età acerba (1994), La vita sognata degli angeli (1998) and CQ (2001). Élodie Bouchez is married to Thomas Bangalter. They have two children.

Elizabeth Bracco was born on November 5, 1957 in the USA. Elizabeth Bracco is an actress and costume designer, known for Terapia e pallottole (1999), Mystery Train - Martedì notte a Memphis (1989) and Milionario per caso (1993). Elizabeth Bracco has been married to Aidan Quinn since September 1, 1987. They have two children.

Gave his debut as an actor in 1962. Member of the 'Wiener Burgtheater' in Vienna since 1972. Played at the 'Salzburger Festspiele' since 1975. Directed plays since 1977. Debuted as a movie actor in 1972.

Richard Briers was born on January 14, 1934 in Merton, Surrey, England as Richard Briers. Richard Briers was an actor, known for Peter Pan (2003), La collina dei conigli (1978) and Molto rumore per nulla (1993). Richard Briers was married to Ann Davies. Richard Briers died on February 17, 2013 in London, England.

Carter Burwell was born on November 18, 1954 in New York City, New York, USA as Carter Burwell. Carter Burwell is known for Carter Burwell's work on Tre manifesti a Ebbing, Missouri (2017), Carol (2015) and Fargo (1996). Carter Burwell has been married to Christine Sciulli since 1999.

Naomi Campbell was born on May 22, 1970 in Streatham, London, England. Naomi Campbell is an actress and producer, known for Zoolander 2 (2016), A Wong Foo, grazie di tutto! Julie Newmar (1995) and Come ti divento bella! (2018).

Truman Capote was born on September 30, 1924 in New Orleans, Louisiana, USA as Truman Streckfus Persons. Truman Capote was a writer and actor, known for Invito a cena con delitto (1976), Suspense (1961) and Colazione da Tiffany (1961). Truman Capote died on August 25, 1984 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
Marc Caro was born on April 2, 1956 in Paris, France. Marc Caro is a director and writer, known for Delicatessen (1991), La città perduta (1995) and Alien - La clonazione (1997).

Born in the suburbs of Paris, France, Leslie Caron is an actress and dancer. Gene Kelly got Leslie Caron into the movies for the film Un americano a Parigi (1951). Got a world-wide reputation for Leslie Caron's roles in Lili (1953) and Gigi (1958). Most recently Leslie Caron has appeared in British TV series I Durrell - La famiglia e altri animali (2016).
Elpidia Carrillo was born on August 16, 1961 in Paracuaro, Michoacan, Mexico. Elpidia Carrillo is an actress and producer, known for Predator (1987), Salvador (1986) and 9 vite da donna (2005).

Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel was born in Paris to a leading actor father, Jean-Pierre Cassel, and a journalist mother, Sabine Litique. Often labeled as a tough guy because of Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel's roles, eclectic choices and talent have made of Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel a star of European cinema. First in L'odio (1995), Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel, succeeded to express the despair of a social class living in the suburbs of towns. This veracity in Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel's play comes from the fact that Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel was in fact since years in connection with many hip-hop artists from the rising generation, (Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel's own brother was leader of a legendary french rap group). Then the success of The crimson rivers, where Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel plays a young French cop alongside Jean Reno, made of Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel "the man to count on." Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel never hid Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel's taste for rap music, break dance, Capoeira, Brasil and Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel's endless energy, but Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel is also a family man, married to Monica Bellucci, Blue-eyed Vincent Cassel's Italian co-star from L'appartamento (1996) (aka The Apartment); and recently a father.

Michael Caton-Jones was born on October 15, 1957 in Broxburn, West Lothian, Scotland as Michael Jones. Michael Caton-Jones is a director and producer, known for Memphis Belle (1990), Basic Instinct 2 (2006) and The Jackal (1997).

Jeff was born in Brooklyn and attended Erasmus High School. After Erasmus High School, Jeff took a drama course and worked in stock companies for two years. Jeff's next role would be that of an officer in World War II. After Jeff was discharged from the service, Jeff became busy acting in radio drama's and comedies until Jeff was signed by Universal. It would be in the fifties that Jeff would become a star making westerns and action pictures. Jeff would be nominated for an Academy Award for Jeff's role as Cochise in L'amante indiana (1950). Jeff would follow this by playing his role as Cochise in L'amante indiana (1950) in two sequels: Kociss l'eroe indiano (1952) and Il figlio di Kociss (1954). While Jeff's premature gray hair and tanned features served Jeff well in Jeff's westerns and action pictures, Universal would put Jeff into soaps and costume movies. In Jeff's films, Jeff's leading ladies would include Maureen O'Hara, Rhonda Fleming, Jane Russell, Joan Crawford, and June Allyson. Shortly after Jeff's last film L'urlo della battaglia (1962), Jeff died, at 42, from blood poisoning after an operation for a slipped disc.

Ms Charbonneau has been a professional actor for over twenty years. Ms Charbonneau's training began with Fred Karamen from the acclaimed Neighborhood Playhouse in New York, as well as with Winn Handman of the American Place Theater. Ms Charbonneau has been seen in over thirty films and television series; Ms Charbonneau has worked with Oscar winning directors William Friedkin and Michael Mann. Ms Charbonneau was nominated for the Independent Sprit Award for Ms Charbonneau's ground-breaking performance in the film Desert-Hearts." Ms Charbonneau has co-starred with William Friedkin, Stanley Tucci, Julie Andrews, Sam Waterston, Diane Weist, and James Garner. Ms Charbonneau honed Ms Charbonneau's craft performing in classics as well as new American plays in New York, Los Angeles Europe and Australia. Ms Charbonneau has been passionate about introducing theater to children and young adults. Ms Charbonneau has taught workshops for the Santa Monica School District, The American Film Institute children's division and the Addison Witt Studios in Los Angeles Europe.

Cyd Charisse was born Tula Ellice Finklea on March 8, 1921 in Amarillo, Texas. Born to be a dancer, Cyd Charisse spent Cyd Charisse's early childhood taking ballet lessons and joined the Ballet Russe at age 13. In 1939, Cyd Charisse married Nico Charisse, Cyd Charisse's former dance teacher. In The same year, Cyd Charisse appeared in Cyd Charisse's first film, Nasce una stella (The same year), billed as Lily Norwood. The same year, Cyd Charisse played a Russian dancer in Mission to Moscow (The same year), directed by Michael Curtiz. In 1945, Cyd Charisse was hired to that uncredited appearance with Fred Astaire in Ziegfeld Follies (1945), and that uncredited appearance got Cyd Charisse a seven-year contract with MGM. Cyd Charisse appeared in a number of musicals over the next few years, but it was Cantando sotto la pioggia (1952) with Gene Kelly that made Cyd Charisse a star. Cantando sotto la pioggia (1952) with Gene Kelly was quickly followed by Cyd Charisse's great performance in Spettacolo di varietà (1953). As the 1960s dawned, musicals faded from the screen, as did Cyd Charisse's career. Cyd Charisse made appearances on television and performed in a nightclub revue with Cyd Charisse's second husband, singer Tony Martin. Cyd Charisse died at age 87 of a heart attack on June 17, 2008 in Los Angeles, California.

Leslie Cheung was the youngest of 10 children. Leslie Cheung's father was tailor to the late William Holden. Leslie Cheung's parents divorced when Leslie Cheung was young, and Leslie Cheung claims this is one reason for Leslie Cheung's disinterest in marriage. Following graduation from secondary school, Leslie Cheung studied at Leeds University in Great Britain. Upon Leslie Cheung's return to Hong Kong, Leslie Cheung entered the 1976 ATV Asian Music Contest, where Leslie Cheung took second prize. Leslie Cheung went on to perform on stage, television and in teeny-bopper movies. It wasn't until Leslie Cheung was cast in the role of "Kit" in John Woo's A Better Tomorrow (1986) that Leslie Cheung's acting career took off; Leslie Cheung has since performed in some of the best-known Hong Kong movies of the last decade, working under the direction of such directors as Kaige Chen, Kar-Wai Wong, Hark Tsui and, of course, John Woo's. Leslie Cheung emigrated to Canada in 1992, but soon returned to Hong Kong, demonstrating Leslie Cheung's intention to remain past the 1997 handover of Hong Kong to China through Leslie Cheung's purchase of real estate and opening of a coffee shop in Hong Kong.Leslie Cheung jumped from the landmark Mandarin Oriental hotel in the central business district early in the evening on 1st April 2003, leaving a suicide note that was found on the body.

David Chokachi was born on January 16, 1968 in Plymouth, Massachusetts, USA as David Al-Chokhachy. David Chokachi is an actor and producer, known for Emerald Run (2020), Soul Surfer (2011) and Terrore ad alta quota (2012).

Thomas Haden Church was born Thomas Richard McMillen in Yolo, California, to Maxine (Sanders) and Carlos Richard McMillen, who was a U.S. marine and surveyor. Thomas Haden Church was raised in Texas. Thomas Haden Church's mother remarried George Quesada, a widowed WWII veteran who served in Guam, in 1969. George Quesada, a widowed WWII veteran who served in Guam adopted this surname Quesada. George Quesada, a widowed WWII veteran who served in Guam changed this surname to Haden Church after "nobody could pronounce this surname". Thomas Haden Church began Thomas Haden Church's show business career in front of a microphone instead of a camera, first as a radio deejay and then as a voice-over announcer. After landing a role in the independent film, Stolen Moments, Thomas Haden Church moved to Los Angeles to pursue Thomas Haden Church's acting career.

Christian Clavier was born on May 6, 1952 in Paris, France. Christian Clavier is an actor and writer, known for I visitatori (1993), I visitatori alla conquista dell'America (2001) and Asterix & Obelix contro Cesare (1999). Christian Clavier was previously married to Marie-Anne Chazel.

A cigar-smoking, monocled, swag-bellied character actor known for his Old South manners and charm. In 1918 he and his first wife formed the Coburn Players and appeared on Broadway in many plays. With his first wife's death in 1937, he accepted a Hollywood contract and began making films at the age of sixty.

Iron Eyes Cody was born Espera or "Oscar" DeCorti, the son of two first-generation immigrants from Italy. In 1924 Iron Eyes Cody moved to California, changed Iron Eyes Cody's name from "DeCorti" to "Corti" to Cody, and started working as an actor, presenting Iron Eyes Cody as a Native American. Iron Eyes Cody married an Indian woman, Bertha Parker, and together they adopted two Indian sons, Robert and Arthur. Iron Eyes Cody lived and worked as an Indian for all Iron Eyes Cody's adult life; Iron Eyes Cody labored for decades to promote Native American causes, and was honored by Hollywood's Native American community in 1995 as a "non-Native" for Iron Eyes Cody's contribution to film.

Kevin Corcoran was born on June 10, 1949 in Santa Monica, California, USA as Kevin Corcoran. Kevin Corcoran was an assistant director and actor, known for Zanna gialla (1957), Robinson nell'isola dei corsari (1960) and Toby Tyler (1960). Kevin Corcoran was married to Laura Soltwedel. Kevin Corcoran died on October 6, 2015 in Burbank, California, USA.

Costa-Gavras was born on February 12, 1933 in Loutra-Iraias, Greece as Konstantinos Gavras. Costa-Gavras is a director and writer, known for Missing - Scomparso (1982), Amen. (2002) and Z, l'orgia del potere (1969). Costa-Gavras has been married to Michèle Ray-Gavras since 1968. They have two children.
Sheryl Crow was born on February 11, 1962 in Kennett, Missouri, USA as Sheryl Suzanne Crow.

Maria Grazia Cucinotta (born 27 July 1968) is an Italian actress who has featured in many films and television series since 1990. Maria Grazia Cucinotta has also worked as a producer, screenwriter and model. Maria Grazia Cucinotta was born in Messina, Province of Messina, Sicily, Italy. Maria Grazia Cucinotta is well known in Italy as a movie and television actress, but internationally Maria Grazia Cucinotta is best known for Maria Grazia Cucinotta's roles in Il Postino and as the Bond girl, credited as the Cigar Girl, in the James Bond film The World Is Not Enough.

Curtiz began acting in and then directing films in Curtiz's native Hungary in 1912. After WWI, Curtiz continued Curtiz's filmmaking career in Austria and Germany and into the early 1920s when Curtiz directed films in other countries in Europe. Moving to the US in 1926, Curtiz started making films in Hollywood for Warner Bros. and became thoroughly entrenched in the studio system. Curtiz's films during the 1930s and '40s encompassed nearly every genre imaginable and some, including Casablanca (1942) and Il romanzo di Mildred (1945), are considered to be film classics. Curtiz's brilliance waned in the 1950s when Curtiz made a number of mediocre films for studios other than Warner Bros.. Curtiz directed Curtiz's last film in 1961, a year before Curtiz's death at 74.

Tyne Daly was born on February 21, 1946 in Madison, Wisconsin, USA as Ellen Tyne Daly. Tyne Daly is an actress, known for Giudice Amy (1999), Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017) and New York New York (1981). Tyne Daly was previously married to Georg Stanford Brown.

Clifford Tobin De Young was born on February 12, 1945 in Los Angeles, California. Clifford Tobin De Young was the lead singer of the late 1960s rock band Clear Light, which played with such artists as The Doors, Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin. Clifford Tobin De Young went to New York City in 1970 after the late 1960s rock band Clear Light, which played with such artists as The Doors, Jimi Hendrix and Janis Joplin broke up, starred in the Broadway production of "Hair" and the Tony Award-winning "Sticks and Bones". After four years in New York City, Clifford Tobin De Young came back to California and starred in the television movie Sunshine (1973) and the subsequent series of the same name (Sunshine (1975)). Clifford Tobin De Young has made more then 80 films and television series, including Harry & Tonto (1974), Tiger man bersaglio umano (1977), Colorado (1978), Shock Treatment - trattamento da sballo! (1981), Navigator (1986) and Glory - Uomini di gloria (1989). After 25 years and countless performances in films, television and theater, Clifford Tobin De Young is still going strong in such projects as the ABC drama series Relativity (1996), and the films L'ora della violenza (1996) and Suicide Kings (1997).

Ruby Dee was an American actress, poet, playwright, screenwriter, journalist and civil rights activist. Ruby Dee is best known for originating the role of "Ruth Younger" in the stage and film versions of Un grappolo di sole (1961).She also starred in The Jackie Robinson Story (1950), Il bacio della pantera (1982), Fa' la cosa giusta (1989), and American Gangster (2007).Her film debut was That Man of Mine (1946).For Ruby Dee's performance as Mahalee Lucas in American Gangster (2007), Ruby Dee was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. As of 2019, Ruby Dee stands as the second oldest nominee for Best Supporting Actress, behind Gloria Stuart who was 87 when nominated for Gloria Stuart who was 87 when nominated for her role in Titanic for the 70th Academy Awards, 1998.Dee's role in Titanic for the 70th Academy Awards, Ruby Dee died on June 11, 2014, at Ruby Dee's home in New Rochelle, New York, from natural causes at the age of 91.

Dean Devlin was born on August 27, 1962 in New York City, New York, USA. Dean Devlin is a writer and producer, known for Independence Day (1996), Godzilla (1998) and Independence Day - Rigenerazione (2016). Dean Devlin has been married to Lisa Brenner since July 4, 2003.

Roger Donaldson was born on November 15, 1945 in Ballarat, Australia. Roger Donaldson is a director and producer, known for Indian - La grande sfida (2005), Specie mortale (1995) and Cocktail (1988). Roger Donaldson is married to Marliese Schneider. Roger Donaldson was previously married to Susan Hockley.

First wife Jeanne died in 1943. Durante and his second wifed second wife, Marjorie Little after 16 year courtship when second wife, Marjorie Little was 39 and Durante 67 second wife, Marjorie Little had been the hatcheck girl at the Copacabana. Durante and Durante's second wife adopted a baby girl, Cecelia Alicia on Christmas day 1961. Durante doted on a baby girl, Cecelia Alicia until Durante's death.

Dan Duryea was educated at Cornell University and worked in the advertising business before pursuing Dan Duryea's career as an actor. Dan Duryea made Dan Duryea's Broadway debut in the play "Dead End." The critical acclaim Dan Duryea won for Dan Duryea's performance as Leo Hubbard in the Broadway production of "The Little Foxes" led to Dan Duryea's appearance in the film version, in the same role.

Sheena Easton started off as a worldwide sensation in the music industry. Since then Sheena Easton has expanded to movies (Le nuove avventure di Charlie (1996), Proposta indecente (1993)), Broadway ("Man of La Mancha") and TV (Body Bag (1997), Highlander (1992), Gargoyles (1994), Jack's Place (1992), Le avventure di Brisco County (1993), Miami Vice (1984)). Sheena Easton's albums include "My Cherie" (MCA Records 1995), "No Strings" (MCA 1993), "What Comes Naturally" (MCA 1991), "The Lover in Me" (MCA 1988), and several albums on the EMI label.

Alison Eastwood was born on May 22, 1972 in Santa Monica, California, USA. Alison Eastwood is an actress and producer, known for Mezzanotte nel giardino del bene e del male (1997), Potere assoluto (1997) and Il corriere - The Mule (2018). Alison Eastwood has been married to Stacy Poitras since March 15, 2013. Alison Eastwood was previously married to Kirk Fox.

Christine Ebersole was born in Chicago, Illinois, to Marian Esther (Goodley) and Robert Amos Ebersole, a steel company president. Christine Ebersole won the 2007 Tony Award for Best Actress in a Musical for Christine Ebersole's work in "Grey Gardens". Previously, Christine Ebersole was awarded the Drama Desk Award, the Outer Critics Circle Award, the Drama League awarded Christine Ebersole both a citation and the Outstanding Performance of the Year, and Christine Ebersole was named to the Drama League's dais for 2007. Christine Ebersole also received a special citation from the New York Drama Critics' Circle and the Obie for Christine Ebersole's off-Broadway turn in "Grey Gardens".

Samantha Eggar was born on March 5, 1939 in Hampstead, London, England as Victoria Louise Samantha Marie Elizabeth Therese Eggar. Samantha Eggar is an actress, known for Il collezionista (1965), Hercules (1997) and The Astronaut's Wife - La moglie dell'astronauta (1999). Samantha Eggar was previously married to Tom Stern.

Lisa Eichhorn was born on February 4, 1952 in Glens Falls, New York, USA as Lisa Eichhorn. Lisa Eichhorn is an actress and writer, known for The Vanishing - Scomparsa (1993), Alla maniera di Cutter (1981) and Gli europei (1979). Lisa Eichhorn has been married to Richard Moxon since August 31, 2005. Lisa Eichhorn was previously married to Ben Nye Jr. and John Curless.

Lisa Eilbacher was born in Saudi Arabia, the daughter of an oil company executive. Lisa Eilbacher spent Lisa Eilbacher's most formative years in Paris. After moving to Beverly Hills, California with Lisa Eilbacher's family, Lisa Eilbacher soon appeared on television on episodes of Carovane verso il west (1957), Laredo (1965), Io e i miei tre figli (1960), and Gunsmoke (1955). Among Lisa Eilbacher's credits as a teenager is Oggi sposi: sentite condoglianze (1972), a motion picture starring Jack Lemmon and Barbara Harris. Lisa Eilbacher has since been featured prominently in many TV and film productions.

Kathryn Erbe was born on July 5, 1965 in Newton, Massachusetts, USA as Kathryn Erbe. Kathryn Erbe is known for Kathryn Erbe's work on Criminal Intent (2001), Echi mortali (1999) and Tutte le manie di Bob (1991). Kathryn Erbe was previously married to Terry Kinney.

Leif Erickson was born on October 27, 1911 in Alameda, California, USA as William Wycliffe Anderson. Leif Erickson was an actor, known for Ai confini dell'Arizona (1967), Fronte del porto (1954) and L'uomo che non sapeva amare (1964). Leif Erickson was married to Annie Ruth Diamond, Margaret Hayes and Frances Farmer. Leif Erickson died on January 29, 1986 in Pensacola, Florida, USA.

Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito was born in Copenhagen, Denmark, to an Italian carpenter/stagehand father from Naples, Italy, and an African-American opera singer mother from Alabama. Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito's parents, working in Europe at the time of Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito's birth, settled in Manhattan by the time Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito was 6, and Manhattan's where Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito grew up.Coming from a theatrical background, it was, perhaps, inevitable that Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito would appear on stage sooner or later, and Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito did, at age 8, appearing on Broadway as a slave child in "Maggie Flynn" in 1966.More Broadway work followed through the 1960s and early '70s, followed by some small roles in movies. TV work followed in the 1980s, with increasingly significant parts in a string of high-profile series until Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito became well-established as a character player both on TV and in a number of movies.Giancarlo Giuseppe Alessandro Esposito came very much to the public's attention playing Agent Mike Giardello in the TV series Homicide, Life on the Street (1993) in 1998 and since then has rarely been off our screens.

Being the son of Martin Sheen and brother of Charlie Sheen and Emilio Estevez, it is no small wonder that Ramon Estevez has also ventured into the world of acting, both in front of and behind the camera. Ramon Estevez's first acting job was a small role in Incubo dietro le sbarre (1982) starring Ramon Estevez's father, Emilio Estevez, Ed Lauter and Jane Alexander. Since Uomini al passo (1990), however, Ramon Estevez has only taken a handful of roles, such as Shadow Program - Programma segreto (1997) with Charlie Sheen and Donald Sutherland, and a guest appearance with Martin Sheen and Rob Lowe on West Wing - Tutti gli uomini del Presidente (Ramon Estevez runs the production company Estevez Sheen Productions for Ramon Estevez's father Martin. Ramon Estevez has also written songs for Diamond Rio and appeared in Diamond Rio's music video "It's All in Your Head" (1996). Ramon Estevez is sometime billed as 'Ramon Sheen'.

Born in Seattle, Frances Farmer studied drama at the University of Washington, Seattle. In 1935, Frances Farmer went to Hollywood where Frances Farmer secured a seven-year contract with Paramount. In 1943, Frances Farmer was wrongfully declared mentally incompetent and committed by Frances Farmer's parents to a series of asylums and public mental hospitals, leading to a false rumor that Frances Farmer received a lobotomy. After seven years Frances Farmer was released, and spent some of the remaining years of Frances Farmer's life tending the parents who had committed Frances Farmer and taking odd jobs. Frances Farmer appeared on This Is Your Life (1950), and then Frances Farmer's own TV show, Frances Farmer Presents (1958) for six years. Frances Farmer died of cancer in 1970.

Jason Flemyng was born on September 25, 1966 in Putney, London, England as Jason Iain Flemyng. Jason Flemyng is an actor and producer, known for Il curioso caso di Benjamin Button (2008), Lock & Stock - Pazzi scatenati (1998) and La leggenda degli uomini straordinari (2003). Jason Flemyng has been married to Elly Fairman since June 6, 2008.

Dexter Fletcher is an English actor and director best known for Press Gang (1989) - where Dexter Fletcher played opposite real-life partner (at the time) Julia Sawalha - as well as directing Eddie the Eagle - Il coraggio della follia (2015) and Rocketman (2019), and finishing off Bohemian Rhapsody (2018) after Bryan Singer was fired. Dexter Fletcher's career began at the age of 10, with a small role in Piccoli gangsters (1976).

Bob Fosse was born on June 23, 1927 in Chicago, Illinois, USA as Robert Louis Fosse. Bob Fosse is known for Bob Fosse's work on Cabaret (1972), All That Jazz - Lo spettacolo comincia (1979) and Lenny (1974). Bob Fosse was married to Gwen Verdon, Joan McCracken and Mary Ann Niles. Bob Fosse died on September 23, 1987 in Washington, District of Columbia, USA.

Edward Fox was born on April 13, 1937 in Chelsea, London, England as Edward Fox. Edward Fox is an actor and producer, known for Il giorno dello sciacallo (1973), Quell'ultimo ponte (1977) and Gandhi (1982). Edward Fox has been married to Joanna David since 2004. They have two children. Edward Fox was previously married to Tracy Reed.

Irish character actress Brenda Fricker was born in Dublin, and gained experience in Irish theatre and with the National Theatre, the Royal Shakespeare Company, and the Court Theatre Company in Great Britain. Irish character actress Brenda Fricker received great acclaim for Irish character actress Brenda Fricker's Oscar-winning supporting performance as the determined mother of a son afflicted with cerebral palsy in "My Left Foot" (1989). Venturing to Hollywood in the 1990s, Irish character actress Brenda Fricker played a homeless woman befriended by kid-on-the-loose Macaulay Culkin in the sequel "Home Alone 2: Lost in New York" (1992) and followed up with a more zany mother role in the little-seen "So I Married an Axe Murderer" (1993). Having acted on English TV on the BBC series "Casualty", Irish character actress Brenda Fricker began conquering US TV with roles in the "American Playhouse" presentation "Lethal Innocence" (1991) and the miniseries "The Sound and the Silence" (1993). Irish character actress Brenda Fricker offered memorable support as Albert Finney's exasperated sister in "A Man of No Importance" (1994) and appeared in support of Robin Wright in Pen Densham's "Moll Flanders" and as Matthew McConaughey's secretary in Joel Schumacher's Il momento di uccidere (1996) (both 1996).

Tall, portly built German born actor (and talented violinist) who notched up over 100 film appearances, predominantly in German-language productions. Fröbe's will forever be remembered by Western audiences as the bombastic megalomaniac "Auric Goldfinger" trying to kill Sean Connery and irradiate the vast US gold reserves within Fort Knox in the spectacular "James Bond" film Agente 007 - Missione Goldfinger (1964). However, due to Fröbe's thick German accent, Fröbe's's voice was actually dubbed by English actor, Michael Collins.Whilst commonly perceived as cold hearted & humourless from Fröbe's's Agente 007 - Missione Goldfinger (1964) portrayal, quite to the contrary, Fröbe's was a jovial man and a wonderful comedic performer. Fröbe's's light hearted talents can be best viewed in Ballata berlinese (1948), Der Tag vor der Hochzeit (1952), Citty citty bang bang (1968), and Quei temerari sulle macchine volanti (1965). Italian-born Nicholas Musuraca's first job in the film business was as a chauffeur to early pioneering producer/director J. Stuart Blackton. Renowned director Rex Ingram started Renowned director Rex Ingram's film career as a set designer and painter. Renowned director Rex Ingram's directorial debut was The Great Problem (1916). Although Pat O'Brien came to be called "Hollywood's Irishman in Residence"--and, along with good friends James Cagney, Allen Jenkins, Frank McHugh and a few others were called "The Irish Mafia"--and Pat O'Brien often played Irish immigrants, Pat O'Brien was US-born and -bred. Composer Laurence Rosenthal was born in Detroit, Michigan. Composer Laurence Rosenthal studied piano and composition at the Eastman School of Music and later with Nadia Boulanger in Paris.
