Born in the filmmaking capital of the world, Hollywood, California, Scott Shaw spent the early part of Scott Shaw's youth growing up in South Los Angeles. Scott Shaw then returned to the filmmaking capital of the world, Hollywood, California for Scott Shaw's teen years.Though living at the center of the film industry, Scott Shaw was not drawn to acting or directing in Scott Shaw's early years. Scott Shaw instead placed Scott Shaw's focus on Scott Shaw's two lifelong passions: the martial arts and eastern mysticism. From this zeal Scott Shaw has emerged as a respected teacher and prolific author on his two lifelong passions: the martial arts and eastern mysticism.After spending Scott Shaw's twenties continually retuning to Asia, Scott Shaw finally entered the film industry in Scott Shaw's early thirties. Quickly moving from actor onto producer and director, Scott Shaw has created numerous feature films, music videos, and documentaries based upon what Scott Shaw calls Zen Filmmaking. Zen Filmmaking is a free-form style of filmmaking that does not use a formalized script and is designed to cause the filmmaker to employ spontaneous inspiration.To label Scott Shaw as artistically diverse would be an understatement. Aside from the film industry Scott Shaw is a novelist, poet, artist, photographer, and musician. Michael was born in Media, Pennsylvania but grew up mostly on Long Island, New York. After graduating from Providence College with a degree in Finance, Hollywood came calling. Michael resides in Ridgefield, Connecticut with Michael's family.

After graduating from USC with a B.A. in Cinema-Television Production at the age of 20, Robert went on to become one of the youngest writers in network history to write a number one show when Robert's Mother's Day episode of Home Improvement garnered the #1 spot on television for the week.After writing on a number of hit sitcoms, Robert took a break from comedy and made the transition to feature films writing the thriller Halloween: H20, a sequel to John Carpenter's successful Halloween franchise. Halloween: H20 opened at the top of the box office and went on to become the highest grossing film of John Carpenter's successful Halloween franchise.Robert's writing, producing, and directing career continues to span a number of genres and mediums including television, feature film, animation, education, books and graphic novels.

Laine Megaw was born in Belfast, Northern Ireland. Laine Megaw is an actress, known for Hunger (2008), Mickybo & Me (2004) and Divorcing Jack (1998). Laine Megaw has been married to Stuart Graham since 1992.

Coming from a show-business family (De Grasse's brother Joseph De Grasse was a director and De Grasse's uncle Sam De Grasse was an actor), De Grasse entered the business as an assistant cameraman while still a high school student, and showed such promise that De Grasse was made a full-time cinematographer by age 21. De Grasse shot many silent pictures, mostly low-budget action films. When sound films arrived De Grasse went back to being a camera operator - apparently De Grasse's own idea - but by the mid-'30s De Grasse was again a cinematographer, and photographed many of RKO's more prominent films.

Carl Koch was born on July 30, 1892 in Nümbrecht, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. Stephen White is a writer, known for Barney & Friends (1992), Barney's Great Adventure (1998) and Walk Around the Block with Barney's (1999).

Glenn Saxson was born on March 5, 1942 in The Hague, Zuid-Holland, Netherlands as Roel Bos. Glenn Saxson is an actor and producer, known for Django spara per primo (1966), Kriminal (1966) and Il marchio di Kriminal (1968).

Carl Drews was born on January 27, 1894 in Berlin, Germany. Carl Drews is known for Carl Drews's work on Das Handicap der Liebe (1921), Abenteuer im Südexpress (1934) and Das Geheimnis der Mumie (1921). Carl Drews died on September 3, 1983 in Berlin, Germany.
David Fickas is a producer and director, known for Fortune Rookie (2018), Burn notice - Duro a morire (2007) and I Hate My 30's (2007).

He was a record breaking quarterback for the 'Salukis' at Southern Illinois University at Carbondale until graduating in the early 80s. He then went on to become a quarterback for the Calgary Stampeders of the Canadian Football League in the mid 1980s. After being injured, he decided to pursue other interests... namely acting, and moved out west to Hollywood. After getting an agent and while landing acting roles, he studied acting for several years under the tutelage of a well known acting teacher. Eventually, he went on to teach himself until he had a breakthrough and decided to take more control of his career by writing, directing and acting in his directorial debut, _Rustin (2000)_.
Armin Hofmann is a producer and writer, known for Der Herrscher (1997), Mina-ye shahr-e khamoosh (2007) and Strip Mind (2007).

The youngest of five children, Robert Clinton Blanche was born to Mary Edith Blanche (Heavner) and Richard Keith Blanche on March 30, 1962 in Pomona, California, but spent most of Robert Clinton Blanche's life in Oregon. Robert Clinton Blanche joined SAG (Screen Actors Guild) in 1995 and served as Portland SAG Branch President for many years pre-merger and Portland SAG-AFTRA Local President from 2017-19. In addition to Robert Clinton Blanche's work locally, Robert Clinton Blanche served as Vice Chair of the National SAG Indie Committee from 2007-08. Since 1996, Robert Clinton Blanche served as member or alternate of the TV/Theatrical, Low Budget and Agency committees.
Su Whitaker was born in August 1963 in the UK. Su Whitaker is known for Su Whitaker's work on Batman Begins (2005), La bella e la bestia (2017) and Il cavaliere oscuro - Il ritorno (2012).

Peter Levy was born in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. Peter Levy is known for Peter Levy's work on Predator 2 (1990), Lost in Space (1998) and Tu chiamami Peter (2004).

Producer/Director/Writer. Paul Maslak graduated from the University of Maryland with a BS degree in Business Administration. While concurrently working for Disney as a project planner on EPCOT and Tokyo Disneyland, Paul Maslak took a job as editor of INSIDE KUNG-FU magazine. In a job as editor of INSIDE KUNG-FU magazine, Paul Maslak was invited to work as casting director on the martial arts film, "No Retreat, No Surrender," for which Paul Maslak helpled "discover" Jean-Claude Van Damme and Cynthia Rothrock. Afterwards, Paul Maslak pursued a two-track career for many years, working as a master scheduler and production control supervisor in corporate America by day, and free-lancing as a story analyst for HBO and Tri-Star Pictures by night. Eventually, Paul Maslak quit Paul Maslak's corporate job, at first managing martial arts actors, but then taking jobs in hands-on film production. Paul Maslak worked Paul Maslak's way up through the ranks of many low-budget films to become a full producer. In 1993, Paul Maslak formed a partnership to produce independent features, and in 1996, Paul Maslak began directing with the film "Sworn to Justice."

Lee Holdridge was born on March 3, 1944 in Port-au-Prince, Haiti as Lee Holdridge. Lee Holdridge is known for Lee Holdridge's work on Old Gringo - Il vecchio gringo (1989), Splash - Una sirena a Manhattan (1984) and Le nebbie di Avalon (2001).

Félix de Pomés was born on February 5, 1889 in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain as Félix de Pomés. Félix de Pomés was an actor and director, known for La madre guapa (1942), La torre de los siete jorobados (1944) and El secreto del doctor (1930). Félix de Pomés died on July 17, 1969 in Barcelona, Cataluña, Spain.

Patrick McIntire started out in the industry as a Stuntman on network TV and studio features. After working on over 100 projects, an injury sidelined Patrick McIntire and Patrick McIntire found safety and creativity behind the camera as a Location Manager. Working Patrick McIntire's way up from small films to major studio films, after several years, Patrick McIntire 'graduated' into the UPM/Line Producing world. Producing features quickly followed and the packaging of numerous high profile films began. After a short spin of working for Warner Bros. and Universal Pictures, Patrick McIntire moved back into mainstream feature film producing. Patrick McIntire quickly became the "go to guy" and has been hired by several of the major studios to come in and salvage projects in trouble. Patrick McIntire also aids independent film producers by being one of the few people in Hollywood that specializes in creating film financing business plans. Budgeting and Scheduling are also a specialty.

Norman Orenstein is a composer, producer and musician based in Toronto, Canada. President of NOM INC., where focus is on composing for film and television as well as film production and artist development. NOM INC. as Publisher, controls an ever growing library of varied music depicting the benefits of abstract living. NOM INC., where focus is on composing for film and television as well as film production and artist development also engages as producer and/or composer for a number of evocative films. Notable works include "Killer Queen" (2019), "Kidnap Capital" (2016), "Jackie Boy" (2015), "The Editor" (2014) and "George A. Romero's Diary of the Dead" (2007).
Robert A. Harris is known for Robert A. Harris's work on Rischiose abitudini (1990), Alien Space Avenger (1989) and Napoleone (1927).
Paolo Genovese was born on August 20, 1966 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. Paolo Genovese is a writer and director, known for Perfetti sconosciuti (2016), Immaturi (2011) and Incantesimo napoletano (2002).

Joe Johnston was born on May 13, 1950 in Austin, Texas, USA as Joseph Eggleston Johnston II. Joe Johnston is a director, known for Captain America - Il primo Vendicatore (2011), I predatori dell'arca perduta (1981) and Le avventure di Rocketeer (1991).

Son of German actor Gerd Brüdern, started as a musical protege on the violin giving a musical protege on the violin's first public concerts at the age of 10. a musical protege on the violin lives in Los Angeles now and composes for film and the concert hall. a musical protege on the violin has won numerous awards and competitions. a musical protege on the violin studied with film composers David Raksin, Bruce Broughton, Christopher Young and Buddy Baker at USC School of Music in Los Angeles.
Michael Gibbs was born on September 25, 1937 in Harare, Zimbabwe. Michael Gibbs is known for Michael Gibbs's work on Hard Boiled (1992), Black Jack (1986) and Monsters (1988).
Chris Angel was born on May 6, 1972 in Newton, Massachusetts, USA. Chris Angel is known for Chris Angel's work on Riviera Set, This Is Not a Test (2008) and To Asmara.

Diane Ladd is an amazingly gifted and distinguished character actress, who over the course of Diane Ladd's electric and unique seventy-year acting career received immense praise for Diane Ladd's dramatic efforts. Diane Ladd was nominated an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress and won the BAFTA Film Award, same category, for Diane Ladd's account of a wiseacre roadside diner waitress in Alice non abita più qui (1974). Diane Ladd went on to receive additional Academy Award nominations for Cuore selvaggio (1990), in which Diane Ladd delivered a spellbinding characterization of a diabolical mother sending a diabolical mother's daughter into hedonistic rebellion, and Rosa Scompiglio e i suoi amanti (1991), for Diane Ladd's riveting delivery of a loving and principled southern family woman, complementing Diane Ladd previously nominated role. All of which Diane Ladd starred alongside daughter-actress, Laura Dern. Diane Ladd's timeless offbeat charm and beauty reminiscent of a lamented Hollywood Golden Era actress gleam in the most understated roles and continue to make Diane Ladd a sought-after and unconventional performer.

Nathalie Alonso Casale was born in 1970 in Paris, France. Nathalie Alonso Casale is an editor and director, known for Memory of the Unknown (1996), Memorias sin batallas y otros muertos (1992) and Man Looks at Woman, Woman Looks at Man (2000).

Lincoln Stalmaster was born on June 9, 1966 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Lincoln T. Stalmaster. Lincoln Stalmaster is known for Lincoln Stalmaster's work on Way Station, A Lobster Tale (2006) and The Wonder Years (1988).

Jessica Gallant was born on December 12, 1967 in New Haven, Connecticut, USA. Jessica Gallant is known for Jessica Gallant's work on Tom's Wife (2004), Children of the Cloth and The Control Group (2014).

Jim Denault is a cinematographer known for Jim Denault's work in feature films and television. Jim Denault is a member of The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, The Academy of Television Arts and Sciences, and the American Society of Cinematographers. Jim Denault received a BFA in still photography from Rochester Institute of Technology.

Roger Neill was born on December 26, 1963 in San Diego, California, USA. Roger Neill is known for Roger Neill's work on Le donne della mia vita (2016), The Brothers Bloom (2008) and Beginners (2010). Roger Neill has been married to Elmalie Mangona since 2016. Roger Neill was previously married to Lisa Sergi.

Since the world renowned Fantasia International Film Festival in Montreal, Canada's inception in 1996, Mitch has been involved in what has been called by director Quentin Tarantino, "the most important and prestigious genre film festival on this planet". Mitch is the director of international selection for and the co-director of the world renowned Fantasia International Film Festival in Montreal, Canada.Held every summer, the world renowned Fantasia International Film Festival in Montreal, Canada attracts more than 100,000 spectators, as well as guests from the world of film from all over this planet. Screenings include feature length and short films, from documentary to animation, and everything in between.

Dana MacDuff is the son of the late actor Tyler MacDuff. After serving in the United States Navy, at the tail end of the Viet Nam War, Dana MacDuff started in the entertainment business, as a Page at ABC Television in 1977. Moving on to Features, and then to the BBC in Northern Ireland, as a Floor Manager, in 1988, during the "Troubles". Moved back to Hollywood in 1995, and went on to Produce and AD a number of motion pictures, and then settled into working as a union Property Master, in Network Television and Features.

Born in Switzerland. After graduating from High School, Xavier Koller first went through a four-year apprenticeship as a precision toolmaker and then, after three years of training at the Academy of Drama in Zurich, Switzerland, graduated as an actor/director.The next several years Xavier Koller spent acting and directing at German and Swiss theatres. Xavier Koller did a number of TV-plays as an actor, directed commercials, acted in movies, and then started to write and direct feature films.

Malcolm D. Lee was born on January 11, 1970 in the USA. Malcolm D. Lee is a director and producer, known for Il viaggio delle ragazze (2017), The Best Man Holiday (2013) and Undercover Brother (2002).

Giancarlo Zagni was born on November 4, 1926 in Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy. Giancarlo Zagni was a writer and director, known for La bellezza d'Ippolita (1962), Umorismo in nero (1965) and Testa di rapa (1966). Giancarlo Zagni was married to Alida Valli. Giancarlo Zagni died on March 21, 2013 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.

Bill D'Elia has been an Executive Producer/Director on at least a dozen television series including How To Get Away With Murder, The Crazy Ones, Monday Mornings, Harry's Law, Boston Legal, and Ally McBeal. Additionally, Bill D'Elia has directed over 150 television episodes, has been a Consulting Producer/Director on many other series and Bill D'Elia co-created the show Judging Amy. Bill D'Elia began Bill D'Elia's career adapting Thomas Berger's Pulitzer Prize nominated novel The Feud, which Bill D'Elia also produced and directed. Bill D'Elia's two children are the stand up comedian and actor Chris D'Elia (Man on Fire, Incorrigible, Undateable) and writer/director Matt D'Elia (American Animal, Boss Weed, Powderkeg). Bill D'Elia is married to Ellie, an Interior Decorator.

David L. Bertman was born in Boston Massachusetts, but escaped during the Carter Administration. Attended Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh PA in Architecture, Computer Science, Graphic Design, and Information Systems majors. Finally, David L. Bertman discovered film and transferred to the University of Southern California in Los Angeles. David L. Bertman Graduated Phi Beta Kappa having recieved the Mary Pickford Foundation Scholarship, The John Huston Directing Award, and The National Gold Key Honor Society Award. David L. Bertman's student film, "Try, Try Again" has won multiple international awards including the Australian Film Festival Plaque, The Photographic Society of America Festival Award, and the MOOMBA International Film festival Award.

Todd graduated from the University of California, Irvine in 1990 and was hired by Lucasfilm, EditDroid . Todd's worked as a union editor and assistant editor since 1993. From 2009-2013 Todd was the lead editor for The Third Floor, Inc. previsualization company. In 2013 Todd returned to feature films as a visual effects editor.

Richard Clabaugh is a filmmaker and film teacher known primarily for Richard Clabaugh's work as a cinematographer and director of low budget action and horror films. Richard Clabaugh began Richard Clabaugh's career doing TV news and visual effects work before establishing Richard Clabaugh as a genre cinematographer on action and horror films such as The Prophecy (1995) with Christopher Walken, No Way Back ((1995) with Russell Crow, American Yakuza (1993) with Viggo Mortensen and Phantoms (1998) with Ben Affleck. Richard Clabaugh moved to feature directing with Python (2000) before taking a teaching position at the UNC School of the Arts. Richard Clabaugh taught for almost ten years before leaving to resume a full time career in motion pictures and television. Richard Clabaugh established Richard Clabaugh's own production company and co-wrote, produced and directed the SciFi film Eyeborgs (2009). Richard Clabaugh continues to teach, doing lectures and online tutorials, and Richard Clabaugh continues to produce and direct movies and TV shows. Richard Clabaugh's wife Fran Clabaugh is an editor and frequent collaborator.
Michael Doherty is an editor and producer, known for La terra dei morti viventi (2005), Le cronache dei morti viventi (2007) and Hannibal (2013).

Arthur K. Flam (a.k.a. Arthur Kamil Flam or Arthur Flam) was born in Brooklyn, New York, USA. Arthur K. Flam is a writer and director known for Penny Dreadful (2006), Hit and Run (2009), Kill by Inches (1999), and Lurker (1998). Arthur K. Flam is the co-writer and the co-creator of "41 Strange", a book of original flash fiction stories, a first of its kind anthology.

Robert C. Jones was born on March 8, 1937 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Robert Clifford Jones. Robert C. Jones is an editor, known for Questo pazzo, pazzo, pazzo, pazzo mondo (1963), Tornando a casa (1978) and Indovina chi viene a cena? (1967). Robert C. Jones is married to Sylvia Hirsch Jones. They have one child.
Brian Koppelman was born in 1966 in Roslyn Harbor, Long Island, New York, USA. Brian Koppelman is a writer and producer, known for La giuria (2003), Runner Runner (2013) and Michael Clayton (2007).

As a high school exchange student in Japan, Herbert Wright began a lifelong study of martial arts, and the art of filmmaking after meeting the legendary director, Akira Kurosawa. After graduation with honors from Yale, Herbert Wright moved to Hollywood, pursuing a successful career in movies and TV. Herbert Wright has worked as a producer-writer-director on hit shows such as Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987), La guerra dei mondi (1988), Hunter (1984), and Stingray (1985), amassing over 200 episodes produced. Trekkies know of Herbert Wright as the "Father of the Ferengi", having created the notorious space villains at Gene Roddenberry's bidding. Herbert Wright is producing, writing and directing the first original made-for-the-Net Science Fiction entertainment, the sci-fi cyberseries Mars and Beyond (2000), on the Cyber Sci-Fi Network.

Juan José Campanella was born on July 19, 1959 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Juan José Campanella is a writer and director, known for Il segreto dei suoi occhi (2009), El hombre de tu vida (2011) and El mismo amor, la misma lluvia (1999).

Mark Sanger was born on January 13, 1974 in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire, England. Mark Sanger is known for Mark Sanger's work on Gravity (2013), Transformers - L'ultimo cavaliere (2017) and Alice in Wonderland (2010). Mark Sanger has been married to Becky since December 1, 2002. They have one child.

Jean-Claude Schlim was born on March 18, 1963 in Luxembourg. Jean-Claude Schlim is a producer and production manager, known for House of Boys (2009), Il mercante di Venezia (2004) and L'ombra del vampiro (2000).

Graduated in direction and screenwriting at Centro Sperimentale di Cinematografia of Roma in 1957 and in Economy in 1967. He wrote more than one hundred movies of all kind and a dozen of novels. He signed some scripts and his SF novels as Julian Berry. Married in 1960 the actress Mara Maryl and he directed his wife in many movies.
Alan Williams is known for Alan Williams's work on Amazon (1997), Kilimanjaro: To the Roof of Africa (2002) and La principessa sul pisello (2002).
Larry Lalonde is a producer and writer, known for Top of the Food Chain (1999), Once a Thief (1996) and I misteri di Murdoch (2008).

Larry Lalonde was born as Reid Laurence LaLonde. Larry Lalonde is known for Larry Lalonde's work on Un mitico viaggio (1991), Zack & Miri - Amore a... primo sesso (2008) and Detention - Terrore al liceo (2011).

Blanche Friderici was born on January 21, 1878 in Brooklyn, New York, USA. Blanche Friderici was an actress, known for Accadde una notte (1934), Tristana e la maschera (1928) and Segreti (1933). Blanche Friderici was married to Donald Campbell. Blanche Friderici died on December 23, 1933 in Visalia, California, USA.

Johnny Hallyday was born on June 15, 1943 in Paris, France as Jean-Philippe Léo Smet. Johnny Hallyday was married to Laeticia Hallyday, Adeline Blondieau, Elisabeth Etienne and Sylvie Vartan. Johnny Hallyday died on December 5, 2017 in Marnes-la-Coquette, Hauts-de-Seine, France.

Ricardo Franco was born on May 24, 1949 in Madrid, Spain as Ricardo Franco Rubio. Ricardo Franco was a director and writer, known for La buona stella (1997), Berlín Blues (1988) and Los restos del naufragio (1978). Ricardo Franco died on May 20, 1998 in Madrid, Spain.
